text:
I have been here twice on the first week. I really enjoyed it. It was a nice departure from masses of greasy food you can expect in a lot of the other bars around. 

The wings were great but could have done with maybe 6. 

The pork belly was fantastic. Deviled eggs were tasty and a $.50 a pop they were good value.

The duck pizza was tasty too.

There are one or two kinks but this place has only been open a couple of weeks. Will definitely be back.

The service was extremely friendly on both occasions.

The booths for NFL Sunday will be great.

Although there is not a no smoking area I didn't find the bar smokey. We had our daughter with us so would have bailed if it was smokey and it wasn't at all.

I am not sure where all the negativity is coming from but what I will say is, the lovers of the Outside Inn were obviously not going enough because it went out of business right?

The best sporting bar hands down In Las Vegas. Bartenders are on point keeping the drinks full at all times. Food and service are both amazing. Not to mention the owner is super friendly and personable. Great place to hang out and watch our Golden Knights!

I really want to love this place but the menu is just too nice for what I'm expecting when I go to a bar walking distance from my house. The food is good but it's not bar food. I guess that's just my problem lol. If you want a nice dinner with a bunch of different beers on tap then this place works great. But just getting a drink with some cheap food..not so much....
Thanks for the reply scooter. I think you have to best most friendly bartenders in Vegas and I don't think the food is bad at all it's all very good. The beer selection is awesome I've tried many food items and all were good. I still bring friends here because your bar is looks amazing and has I very local feel. Instead of selling shitty food for super cheap you sell really good food for a little bit more. And bring back the $0.25 pinball machine lol not the stupid x-men one and you should sell boneless wings and cheese sticks.

on the 20th, someone mentioned on facebook that there were bad reviews on yelp. since then, there have been nothing but glowing 4 and 5 star reviews. think the owners got their friends to pump them up. I do. c'mon yelp. I was there. not impressed. menu is way too ambitious for a sports bar. some people may like that. I don't. overpriced and off the wall menu. maybe that's why they won't post it on their website. owners need to make up their minds. do they want to be a neighborhood sports bar like they claim, or do they want to be an upscale, overpriced, overrated bistro gastro pub in a neighborhood location. if I want to get ripped off I can go to the strip. i'm looking for a true neighborhood pub. hope they go in that direction.

We have been there several times since it opened.  Every time we have gone it has been outstanding.  We have had almost everything on the menu.  I have to say our favorite thing is the wings.  There is no where in town where they have better wings.  The steak sandwich is amazing along with the pork belly appetizer.  The service has always been spot on.  They are friendly and quick to make you feel at home.  If you want better quality of food while enjoying the game, this is where to go.  It is worth the extra money.  The food is great and the service is good.

I've been here three times already and I will probably continue to come back here. The location is a great spot for me. I can even walk from my house to get here. The bar is set up very nicely. I love the tiered TVs surrounding the bar. I don't really think there's a bad seat if you want to watch a game. The service was good. The staff was friendly and courteous and prompt. The beer selection was good and priced fine. I do like the food here too. So far I've had the Chicago dog and the pork sandwich, both of which were very good. I know where I will be on Sundays come the start of football season!

Meh. Menu is a bit too much for a "sports bar" it's a beautiful place and it's a fun place to be but the food is a complete let down. The chef is supposedly from Bouchon in the Venetian but it doesn't show. Gnocchi was gummy and bland. The garlic shrimp were muddy, over cooked on the outside and partially raw on the inside. The pig ears were a step away from jerky treats from petsmart and the manager staff was drinking at the bar during service hours. The chef has a big head and needs to be knocked down a bit or replaced. Gotta say tho, the pork rinds were the best thing we had...beside the beer. The beer Mac and cheese wasn't bad either. This place still needs a lot of work and prices need to be kicked down. I recommend eating somewhere else before coming here to catch the game. Unless the kitchen gets their stuff together and realize that this place is a sports bar in a residential area...it's not going to last 4 months. Not to mention there are only two girls behind the bar that actually give a damn, the rest are useless. The pregnant blonde and the tall skinny brunette are awesome though. And the owner is pretty hands on and really nice, he's there all the time. All in all...We all want Outside Inn back.

The 2 stars are because it is close to home. The food tasted frozen and microwaved. It was dry and lacking flavor other than salt and a heaping mass of goat cheese to mask their poor excuse of a fancy gourmet salad. The bartender and waitress although friendly were unattentive. The lighting/atmosphere caters to single 40+ year olds with a gambeling problem and no life. Management disrespected /embarrassed the bartender in front of guests....unprofessional! We will never go back and will tell our friends as well..wait staff get out while you can!

The food is overpriced and not worth it and it's not a gaming bar. Can't usually find an open chair because non-gamers take them to watch tv, and there's no promotion for slot play. Seems like they could care less about your business.

Extremely impressed with this place. I've had the pleasure of having Jason, Troy, and Jenny serve me. All three were super helpful, informative, and welcoming. On top of the excellent service their food is BOMB! I reccomend the chicken nachos.

For a place that's trying to be a sports bar, their set up is all wrong. They have a ticker, which is a cool idea but what's the point when you can only see it from one small section of the bar? 
There are two rows of big tvs that go around the bar, unfortunately if you're sitting at the bar you have to strain your neck to see the top row of tvs. They should have angled the top row down so you can actually view them. 
As for their food, the items I've tried I've enjoyed. The short rib is pretty great and the duck confit pizza was decent, nothing too exciting.

Fabulous place!!!

Great Big TVs with good visibility from a large bar.

Solid Beer Selection.

Food is beyond belief and better than anything you will ever have in a Sportsbar.

Try the Shortribs.....

really good.
This is a really great sports bar. The atmosphere is great and so is the food. I highly recommend the steak tacos.
Tiffany is the best waitress, hands down. She's friendly, spunky, and very personable.

We have been waiting for this place to open up, and the wait was worth it. The food is amazing. Better than any "average bar food", it's a great MEAL. You aren't overwhelmed with a huge menu, but a great selection of appetizers,  entr√©es,  pizzas, burgers and salads. Chef Daniel is awesome and made it a point to introduce himself. His food is fantastic and the service is superb. There are plenty of huge flat screen TVs, and if your game isn't on the bar volume they give you a speaker so you can hear whatever game you want to watch.  Plus,  they have great steel tip dart board set up, which is the icing on the local bar cake.

Just a little side note from my rant about the slow (special cause variation) food delivery. It is back to normal and tasting very good. We all have bad days that this may have been one of those days that should not form the basis of "usual" service! This place is a very good spot and "Yes" I frequent it often! :-)

Besides, the beer is cold and yeah... COLD!!! LOL!!!  Oh and the wings are good too!!!
Never disappoints-awesome gourmet food and service, and always has any game you'd like on. My go-to place for all my sportsing needs!
helpful and courteous staff, mike makes a banging pastrami sandwhich, try it.

Tried to love this place because I love the Seahawks and wanted a good Hawks bar to watch games but I will NOT be back!! Every time I have come, I have noticed the bar tenders having a lot of attitude and shitty customer service and the final straw was them bitching about a bunch of us PAYING CUSTOMERS requesting a game change on one of the TV's because it was an absolute blowout game. Not a one person requesting but everyone sitting on that side of the bar. Will not be back, I'd rather spend my money at a place with some good customer service.
Favorite bar to visit when Mia is working! No matter how busy it gets she's still fast with jokes! Mia and sporting life rock; great TV's, awesome food, jukebox, patio, darts.

I just love this place!! Always great food and good company especially the bartenders!! Levi, although new he knows how to rock the bar! Entertained and well taken care of! I have nothing bad to say about this place! I always recommend to people who are wondering about awesome food and awesome people to meet around the southwest!

Stopped in to watch the game with my girl and have a couple of drinks. Mia was the bartender and she was impressive, friendly and efficient. She was knowledgeable about drinks and menu.  Menu options are varied, we had the chicken tenders.  Hot sauce is very hot with a great flavor. Patrons are friendly. Good times to be had by all!  Will definitely come back again!

Really nice place to watch the game. Lots of TVs and great atmosphere. One of the bartenders was good. The other one was quite tacky!  Take that pen out of your cleavage. Soooooo tacky.  Most of the clientele were great. Struck up conversation with a few people and they were great. Bartender/ manager need to tell some ( one) to stop the constant yelling. It made it very uncomfortable. We all love football Ms Brady fan, but we actually chose to go somewhere else because of your yelling.

So I started coming here when I moved into the neighborhood. I usually have great experiences. However, the last time I was here during "late night", the bartender was horrible. Everyone else is great, but this is the second time I've had to deal with this guy who clearly hates his job. I wish I could remember his name, but he's the worst. Our burger took forever to come out, and when it did, the bun was burnt. I can usually get over shitty food if the service was good, but he didn't seem to care at all one way or the other. Put this guy out of his misery! Taller, stocky white guy with a bald head. I'd like to say I'll get his name next time I go in. Buy I make it a point now not to come here after 11.
This place has the best "bar" food I have ever had! Great for lunch or dinner. Also nice to be able to play on some quality dart boards!

This is a spacious place to go watch some sports on tv-and they have plenty. Service was excellent but food was ok. Maybe it was me. I think you need to try it for yourself as we all have different taste buds.

I don't know what they put in the drinks here but if you're looking to make an impression take your date here. The drinks are so good you magically become fantastic at darts. I've never thrown a dart in my life and I hit the bullseye 8 times AND then kicked everyone ass at an actual game of darts. If that doesn't say 5 stars I don't know what does. Oh and they have pretty much any game that could possibly be going on aired on one of their TVs. I'm pretty sure I saw a cricket game on there last time.

My wife and I are from Texas and visiting Vegas and wanted to have a few drinks and see the local scene, we asked a guy at our hotel and he suggested the Sporting Life Bar.  We went and it had an amazing atmosphere and TV's with every game on. Our bar tender Levi was amazing, we only drink Texas beers and he suggested a few beers that he thought we would like because they didn't have Shiner Bock, but I haven't been anywhere in this city that does.  He got us a Longboard which was great and very close to what we are used to.  Although the bar was busy Levi talked to us and told us all about some great local attractions and it was just an overall great night thanks to Levi, we have him to thank about our amazing night in Vegas.

I had such high expectations for this place. It's my neighborhood bar and I wanted so badly to love everything about this place, but sadly that wasn't the case. To start the service was awful! Ashley was our "bartender" and she seemed to be way too occupied with her conversations with other guests to make my requests a priority. I would ask for some napkins, and she would literally take 5 minutes to bring me back paper napkins. I would be chewing on the ice of my empty drink and she would ask "refill" and I would kindly say "yes". She would then go finish her conversation with another group before taking the 20 seconds to fill my drink. 

Next up on the list was the food. I ordered green chili pork nachos. The entire top layer of the nachos were cold and the bottom were steaming hot. That concerned me considering it was PORK. It had so much flavor, but just couldn't get over it being cold and I refuse to send items back. 

My final issue, and honestly the most bothersome part of this place (and the reason I probably won't be back), is the fact they don't comp food for slot players. Excuse me? Bars main source of revenue is from gaming!!!! How do you get gaming customers??? COMP MEALS!!!! There are hundreds of bars in this town offering FREE meals to slot players. If you expect me to be loyal to your bar, I expect a free meal when I feed the machine hundreds. Very poor decision by ownership/management. 

I do want to shout out Neil. After our meal and after I lost $500 in the machine, I played some darts. Neil was quick to bring us drinks and very personable. He asked our names, and remembered our names for the rest of the evening. Neil gets 2 thumbs up!!

Came here to watch some football this past weekend. I gotta say I love what they did to this place!

It's a lot of fun with a limited but very good food menu, unique draft line for those down to try new things and a very clean bar!

Only downside I have is that the tvs are position really awkwardly and if your sitting on any end of the bar you will be forgotten about. Bartenders don't tend to walk that far and service is a complete lag. 

Besides that, I would definitely come back to grub and have a beer after a hard day at work, but I'll pass when it comes to football. It just doesn't quite have it down yet.

Walking into a sports bar just after the Oregon-Ohio championship started, I didn't expect to be able to find a table. But Sporting Life surpasses a lot of expectations. We were able to find a table easily, and the staff were welcoming and friendly, food was on par with a gastropub and prices were on par with the quality.

DEVILED EGGS: Simple but delicious, at an old-school price of fifty cents each!
PRETZEL BITES WTIH CHEESE ($5 game day deal): tasty pretzels, soft and not too salty, with a tasty cheese sauce. First order, the cheese was too thin (like water), table later purchased an additional order and the cheese was the right consistency.
MARINATED SKIRT STEAK ($10): great char and flavor, cooked just right and only a touch tough, served over some crazy-tasty potatoes
GERMAN BRAT & FRIES ($5 Game Day Deal): such crispy fries! Snagged a few of my friend's before just ordering a plate of my own. Sausage wasn't quite as flavorful as back home (nor was the 'kraut), but both were solid on their own. The mustard it's served with is wicked good though, ask for extra!
SHORTRIB FLATBREAD ($13): So friggin' good. Almost didn't order a flatbread due to the very mixed reviews, but opted for this one based on the server's recommendation and was blown away by the ample portion of meat, light but great bleu cheese, with accents of onion and mushroom. Would get this again!
WINGS (4 whole, $11): Almost didn't try these (partly due to the price) but my guy has a thing for whole wings. Opted for the hot sauce on the side, which was super spicy and a weird consistency. The wings themselves were perfect as-is: lightly fried, super crispy, just a sprinkle of salt for flavor, some of the best I've had.

Service from servers, food runners, and bartenders was solid throughout the night, and the owner Scooter even came out and introduced himself- he's a 49ers fan, so that automatically made him a new friend. Definitely a place we'll be coming back to for games- they have 24 screens and there isn't a bad seat in the house.

We come here every so often. Tiny draft beer selection. The dart boards are fun. Service is fine for a bar, nothing to rant about. Food is so inconsistent depending on who the cook is that night. All in all chill little regular sports bar. Just regular.
Great neighborhood bar. Was very surprised at how good the food was. Try the chicken wings, they are full wings and the mild are pretty hot. Oh, and the fried Oreos are a must try.
Try the "Skins n Balls".... I love them. Definetly worth comin back for just those. And i like the screens everywhere for all the games. Especially wit MLB comin back

Let me start by beating I am one to not complain unless I have a strong reason to. I came to the bar tonight to play keno and definitely not to expect any thing but to be treated like everyone else. 
So I started $100 in a machine and ordered my drink. Lost the $100 and moved to another machine before finishing my first drink then another machine . I had put $100 in 5 machines when I got to the 6th machine I put another $100 and decided to order some food. At this time I took $200 out of the ATM. Here's where it got messed up. At this time I decided to order food the chicken sandwich and wings to go. 
Like I said I don't expect anything but to be treated as a local like every where else. We decide to spend money at certain establishments and spend our hard earned money anywhere and with the amount of local bars we have in Vegas what are local bars gonna offer for me to come back? 
So when I asked how much I owed for the food; the Asian bartender she presented me with a check??? After I had dropped $500 in the machines. So I paid and didn't say anything. Later on when she was off I asked the Asian male who came in at 11p if they comped food for players? He said they did. So I told him I had put $500 into the machines and the $400 I had won into the machines and that she charged me for the food. If anything if I were to ever come back to this establishment it would be cause of him. 
It sad that I WOULD NEVER come back to this establishment especially since it's so close to home. 
Once again by all means am I a whaler but the money I work hard for I would rather give it to another bar. So if you decide to come to this bar to gamble or to be treated as a local, your better off going somewhere else to spend your money.
And the food was mediocre at best. The chicken sandwich was good. But don't expect to have the usual wings that you are used to.

Drinks and food are priced reasonably, fun atmosphere, good service, yet the food in my opinion was lacking. 

I had the portobello burger and it was bleh. Kind of soggy in texture and fell apart. The pesto really made the flavor and helped me finish it. Hummus was GROSS. Worst I think I've ever eaten and my expectations of hummus aren't too high. Hummus is hard to screw up in my opinion. Unfortunately my boyfriend ate it all resulting in an impossible return to the kitchen. 

Overall, this is a bar and a restaurant. So, as bar this place gets 4 stars. :)

Crappy things about this place:

Fries were dry/unseasoned... asked for ranch dip, bland AF. Probably the crappiest fries I've had ever. 
We were sitting in the booths on the side... around 10pm. Midway through our meal, someone decided to turn off the lights in our section while we're eating. Um, okay. I can't see my food anymore thanks! Had to tell them to turn it back on... lol There's a first for everything, I guess.
Beer battered mushrooms... 90% batter and oil. Gross.
Biggest pet peeve: when they give you the check, and then disappear for 10 minutes and all you're trying to do is GTFO, so you have to track them down to pay. Hate that so much, and of course it happened here.


On the plus side:

Chicken sandwich was good and warmed spinach salad was good. Pork belly was good, but the polenta underneath was meh. Definitely not enough for me to go back. Will take my money elsewhere. UGHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH.

This is my new locals bar during normal rush hours since BAR is too packed and doesn't play the games that we like (Warriors, UCLA games). The drink prices are awesome $4.50 for Moscow Mule and a great environment to watch games with friends. I like their end of quarter raffles during football games, it really livens up the mood. Our friend won a beer mug for one of the raffle prizes.

Didn't get to try out the darts section but it looks fun!

Food: The pork belly over pilenta was surprisingly delicious but portion was a bit small for a ~$10 dish. The $5 bites are a good deal but a bit bland. Will come mostly for the drinks!

Heard a lot about this place and I was highly satisfied!!! We ordered the Deviled Eggs and Wings to start and let me say this, they both we fantastic.  Wings are the best wings I've ever had in this city. We got all the different styles of sauces on the side and loved them all.  If you're looking for an Asian infused type, then get those for the wings other than that any way you get them, they're tasty and served to perfection.  For entrees we ordered the Portobello Mushroom Sandwich which was huge compared to what I imagined it. Full of flavor and the pesto sauce that comes on it is delicious. We also got the chicken sandwich and that is amazing. It was served with a sunny side up egg and once you bite into it, the yolk pops and gets soaked but by that wonderful homemade brioche bun. Tasty and so yummy. We got French fries and house field greens salad as our sides and got the best homemade French fries, non that you can get anywhere. Plus the house field greens and homemade vinaigrette goes so well with that portobello mushroom sandwich. 

This ain't no typical sports bar and lounge type of food, it's in a caliber like no other. You will never find a place like this here in Vegas. It's clean, great atmosphere, friendly wait staff, great bar and great management team.  I got to meet one of the owners there Scooter and he was absolutely friendly and personable with us as we had dinner.  He checked in and see how things were going and we let him know!! Troy was an awesome server and local boy from Hawaii.  He loves serving his guest and has passion behind that. He definitely shared with us the "aloha" spirit.  Thank you gentlemen for making our first visit there a memorable one.  Highly recommend and let me tell you don't listen to those people who are so anal about certain places and try to compare them to others.  It's unique, different and something's people can't take.  Change is great and this place really changes your aspect and outlook on your so called "sports bar." Thank you again Troy and Scooter, we will be back!!!

Was not impressed by the food, beer selection, prices, service, or decor. Plus it's the brightest lit bar I think I've ever seen. This a bar, not a store. Turn down the lights a bit. Not every great beer is a hop loaded monstrosity, expand your selection.

Asked for a veggie sandwich to take home to the wife after Tuesday Night Trivia and he created a grilled carrot & quinoa on toasted bun that was just AWESOME...my wife thought it was just the greatest thing...and it really helped after I got home late after a night out of beer and Trivia with my friends. I must say the chef was just great to whip this up even it wasn't on the menu...all the food here is just the BEST! Friends, Beer, Trivia, always a great time...Living the High Life @ The Sporting Life!
Sat down, waited for 10 minutes. No servers in sight, bartender texting on her phone. We left. Needless to say, I won't be back.

I give this place credit for trying have a better menu than most loser bars but it may prove to be a bit over ambitious for the late night chefs to execute perfectly.. I've had the chicken sandwich 3 times.. And it's been good twice.. The pizzas or flatbreads have been a miss for me.. The short rib philly wasn't too good.. Pork belly good, hummus no.. Deviled eggs tasty.. Potato skins um ok I guess...

Edit: I come here pretty regularly.. And for bar food goes, this place is better than most.. So cheers to them for giving a shit about their food unlike 99% of the piece of crap bar owners in this town who only care about gaming money from degenerate gamblers losing their whole paycheck..

Oh the new beef kimchee sandwich is great..

Great place to watch a game. Lots of TVs, good food and a decent selection on tap.  Just don't go when Steff is working. She seems to be more interested in texting than paying attention to the customers.  Go when Muoy or Ashley are working. They will make sure you're drink is full and you're having a good time.  Nachos are reallllllllly good. They are a mile high and will fill you up! Deviled eggs are great too if you're looking for a quick bite.  All in all, a great place to hang during game days.

Searching down bars that have decent beer, are clean, have a good food selection, have internet, and a place to plug in is harder than one might think. Tonight I needed to get some work done and was suggested this place by a friend. I have to say that this was a GREAT selection and will definitely be a frequent place for enjoying adult beverages while I'm working on my computer. 

The beer selection isn't huge but it's pretty good and I have to give them major props because they have several local selections. I love that kind of thing. 

The menu looked great and there were tons of things on there I'm definitely going to try. This isn't your typical bar menu. We had the peanuts and pork rinds dish as well as pork belly with grits. Being from the South I'm pretty picky on my grits and those were spot on. Well done all the way around.

The place is laid out well and clean. It's not that super dark or conversely super bright bar. The atmosphere is great. While it's sports themed, there aren't six thousand different sports posters all over the walls. The decorations are tasteful and retro. 

All in all I really liked this place and could kick myself for not stopping in earlier. I will definitely be back to try out more of this menu
Get magic Mike's pastrami it's delicious.  Not on the menu... but ask for it. Secret menu!

Just had the best service and coldest beer EVER in las Vegas. Wish we had more than 30 minutes to spend,  definitely coming back.  The fried dill pickles were 5 stars.   The rest of the menu sounds scrumptious. We are a definite be back.

i discovered this place when i was online looking for establishments that have steel tip dart boards.  my friends and i have recently become very avid dart enthusiasts.  i somehow stumbled across sporting life bar so one day we decided to check it out.  little did i know that it was located in the same plaza as tonkatsu kyoshi, one of our favorite spots.  i was slightly hesitant at first because of the less-than-enthusiastic ratings on yelp.  but as soon as i walked through their front door, i was immediately impressed.  the place is large and open, airy and clean, and the dart boards are brand new with cork board tiled along the walls and located on an elevated platform with extremely good lighting.  it's difficult to find a place that cares enough to make sure that the darting area is above average.  there's a beautiful reclaimed wooden bar area to place your belongings and/or food and drinks on.  there's also an enormous reclaimed wooden picnic table that can seat a large party which came in handy when we had 20 people there for the hubby's birthday celebration.

now onto the food.  the food is not your typical bar food although there are some bar food items on the menu like nachos and tacos.  as i said, however, their versions are atypical for a bar.  the executive chef hails from bouchon so he puts his special spin on all of their offerings.  i've had many dishes and some of my favorites are the gnocchi (which is potato free, btw), the flowering kale salad, the polenta, the special veggie dish of the day, the tomato bread, the deviled eggs and the nachos.  many of my friends have enjoyed other dishes like the burger, the korean style bbq ribs, the pork belly, and the pig ears and skins.  i've had the bread pudding twice.  it was so delicious the first time.  it was gooey and custardy with the perfect consistency.  then the 2nd time i tried it, it was really dry and disappointing.  i think consistency is important and, for the most part, i find everything to be pretty consistently good.  sure, there are things that need ironing out but, overall, i've been very happy with everything i've had here.  if they could just get that bread pudding to be the same every time, i'll be a very happy camper.

they also offer a lot of fun things at slb.  tuesdays at 7pm is pub quiz night which we've attended a few times now and have had a lot of fun.  wednesdays at 7 and 12, they have dart tournaments.  we've not attended one yet but plan to soon.  they offer happy hour deals but i can't remember what days and/or times at the moment.  now that it's football season, they're even doing food and drink specials during the games.  

although i live a good 20 minutes away, i absolutely love coming here and spending time eating good food, pub quizzing, and throwing darts with friends.  it's our "cheers" i suppose.  troy, marie and gemma are always so kind and helpful and never give us a hard time no matter how long we stay there and bug them.  scooter, the owner, is also a pretty awesome dude.  slb is our new goto hangout spot and i'm happy to drive the distance.  but i gotta say, i hope scooter considers opening one on my side of town someday.  =)

Had a very good dining experience here on 8/20/15.  Burgers, tacos, and nachos--all very good.  The 25 TVs looked great.  Very good selection of draft beer. A really nice addition to the southwest side of Vegas.

I have to give it three stars because while my food was amazing, my girlfriend's food was awful.

The decor of the place is pretty cool and from our vantage point sitting in one of I think 5 booths, I could see at least 7 TVs, all playing different sports channels.  We sat down and the waitress came over and brought us menus and asked what we wanted to drink.  Now even though it was a holiday, Easter, we decided not to be day drinking at 11 am.  So we both got orange juice.

Looking over the menu, the choices are not very extensive, but from viewpoint, as long as the food is good, who cares how many selections they have?  I decided on the French toast which they described as being done bread pudding style.  I didn't know what that meant, but since I know I like bread pudding, it sounded like I would enjoy it.  My girlfriend ordered the breakfast sandwich with sausage.

For being a Sunday morning and we were one of 8 or 9 customers, the food took a little longer than expected.  When it arrived, I was pleased with how mine looked and smelled and after the first bite, I was very impressed.  Definitely try the French toast if you go.

My girlfriend's sandwich and the hash browns that accompanied it were definitely not as appealing.  The bun for the sandwich was either very old, or the toasting process made it stale.  Either way, it was terrible.  The hash browns also were very flat.  And by very, I mean they may have stood 1/2 inch off the plate.

So overall, I'd return, but my girlfriend may not.  Might as well try something new and see how you like it!

Pretty great sports bar! I like that they have the have small speakers so u can listen in on your teams game if it's not the one on the bar speakers.the menu selection is great and the happy hour menu is very generous and awesome! I also like that the happy hour is a little different than that of the other bars in the area. 
   I would have given 5 stars but the bar games could be better but hey ya can't please everybody. The service isn't great but the servers all pretty nice. 
   The crowd age ranges from mid 20s - 30's and it's always a pretty good turn out.

Moved to the neighborhood in March. Found this place which is close to my house. Tried a few items on the Menu. The philly, nachos, deviled eggs, mac and cheese and the chicken wings. The wings were awesome! Nachos needed more cheese. Decent selection of beers on tap and lots of TV's. Bartenders were very attentive and social. Overall a great vibe that I keep coming back to. Its nice having a local sports bar thats not a PT's or BWW.

Maybe the best bar for Sports in Vegas:super clean,brand new and menu is off the chain for a sports bar.Customer service is also wonder with Doogie and Stef  running the show.From Chicago dogs to Classic French Cuisine. How cool is that!  Active Dart Area for patrons close to bar so you never Feel away from the action.Also they have private booths 10 ft. Away from bar for intimacy, but you still can see the game perfectly. I live 2 blocks from here and will DEFINITELY be back.   Great Job guys. See ya, soon.

Fun, local, neighborhood bar!

Visited this bar a couple times usually at night with some friends to grab some drinks. Its fun and lively with trivia games, darts, drinks and some good night time eats its been a pretty great time each visit. 

Stopped in for lunch for the first time and it was a little different. Not as loud that's for sure and experienced a more chill time. 

Enjoyed a few appetizer plates. Bacon wrapped dates, fried mushrooms and the pork belly. All three were really good but my favorite was the dates. The pork belly was soft and really tasty. 

We were recommended the crepe with nutella and fresh strawberries with whip cream and drizzled with chocolate. Sounds yummy right?! So I was a Lil disappointed when we ordered it and it came out without whip cream and chocolate, the crepe was a Lil dry and kind of didn't taste all the way cooked. Needless to say, I won't be ordering it again. 

This is a cool spot so check it out.
Hidden gem in south Vegas. They have Estrella Damm beer and outstanding food. Great place to hang out and watch sports. It is a magisterial place. Check it out!
Great bar food with drink specials. Not crowded and my new spot to watch games if my Panthers aren't on TV.

I've just recently moved to the Enterprise area and checked out a few local bars & pubs. I'd say Sporting Life is the nicest and most fan-friendly, given their numerous HD LED TVs and ample seating. The food was good and the drinks reasonably priced. If there's one thing keeping me from giving it 5 stars, it would be the smokiness. I realize smoking is still prevalent in LV but having it spill over from the neighboring booth while eating isn't very enjoyable. Nevertheless, I highly recommend SL as your go-to neighborhood sports bar and if you're into trivia, make sure to look them up on Tuesday's!
Great place. Servers are super nice. Owner very involved with customers. Great place to watch college football. O H I O

This place was great. The food was not your typical bar food. We ordered apps to start with. Nacho's and the beer battered mushrooms were very good, we could have just eaten those cause the portions were huge. I ended up ordering the chicken sandwich with a sunny side up egg on it. I've never had a chicken sandwich with an egg on it before but it worked. The egg was cooked perfectly and the chicken was moist and crispy. The only complaint and it's a small one would be that it doesn't really feel like a sports bar but the food more then makes up for that.

We came into play tonight and out of all the machines maybe 5 people were playing. We used to like this bar however due to not being able to get a machine while people are not actively playing (no money in machine at all) we will look else where
Great buffalo wings 1/2 off on Saturday & The Pastrami sandwhich is awesome ask for  Mike to cook it if he's working!

Finally found a bar that has darts AND it's right in ma' hood! They have steel tipped darts. Wow! Chalk boards to keep your own score and pin ball machines in the house. Plus sports boards so you can check the lines on your favorite teams!
The bar staff is super friendly and nice too. 
This is a sweet spot to chill at. 
I tried the pretzel there and it is HUGE, comes out in a smiley face with different dipping sauces for your pretzel pleasure!

A Sports Bar for foodies?...certainly the best I've experienced in Vegas.  Sporting Life Bar is not a Gastro Pub, it is a non-ashamed Sports Bar with big screens, game-time specials, video gaming and a well-lit area for darts.  But where most sports bars stop, SLB takes over and delivers food selections that keep food-focused individuals coming back.

Food items that stand out include:
Pork Belly - braised pork belly served over creamy 
Portabello Mushroom Sandwich
Short Rib Philly
Short Rib Flatbread - Their flatbreads are actual flatbreads though, not an oblong shaped pizza that you would get at most places these days.  Expect the thin flatbread to be thin and crispy...in the cracker vein. 

SLB has many standard sports bar items like nachos, burgers and sandwiches as well.  Also try a Deviled Egg for $.50--nothing to come in specifically for, but certainly better than the ones that came to your last potluck. 

Draft selections are not the best around, but are certainly sufficient with Firestone Walker Union Jack IPA, Green Flash Hop Head, Brooklyn Lager, Weihenstephaner Hefe, Deschutes Black Butte Porter, Joseph James Hop Box, and Teneya Creek Nut Brown on the list.
Wouldn't recommend this place. Short rib philly wasn't very good and beer was way overpriced.

YUMS! I enjoyed the deviled eggs. The Bavarian pretzel was the size of my face and it was delicious. Staff were sweet. Definitely a good place when it comes to watching the games! GO OSU!  I disliked not being being able to find a seat, walking aimlessly around, staring at the squatters that were saving multiple tables for people that NEVER came. So, come early or come all together, especially on Sundays. Oh, but did I tell you about this amazing bread pudding they have?? It's AMAZING.
Nice place to see basketball game   Amazing food and awesome chef ! We tried BibimBob korean food. Actually  he did really well and the duck trio platewas amazing!!!!!!!!!
Interesting menu items  (not your typical bar food), tasty though and plenty of TV'S which always make for a good game watch location

Holy shit this place is awesome!  

On a recent trip to Vegas with the boys we wanted to get off the strip and enjoy the sanity of a local sports bar...so we laid down our NFL bets at the sports book, checked my Yelp app and hopped in a cab to enjoy some local flavor.  So glad we did.  We thought we were walking into  just another sports bar, but Sporting Life Bar is more like a high end restaurant with TV's everywhere.  Days later I'm still amazed at the quality of the food at this place.  Never have I been to a sports bar (or any bar really) with food I continue to rave about to all my friends.  We had the wings, nachos with carne asada, beer battered mushrooms, marinated skirt steak small plate and  Reuben's.  We would have kept eating but we were getting drunk and needed to make more bets....yes I said needed...get off my back.  Anyway, wings....holy balls.....they are cured in salt and spices/herbs for a while and then cooked in duck confit for like 6 hours and then fried to order in peanut oil.  They are the whole wing as well...and absolutely fantastic.  Fall off the bone and still tender and juicy, not dried out at all.  The nachos are gourmet...not the chips out of the bag sprinkled with shredded cheddar bullshit you get at most bars...ya know, where you pick up one nacho and the whole pile wants to come with that one chip?  Not here.  Thick tortilla chips are fried to order and a melted cheese mixture (REAL cheese) is poured over the entire order along with any additional toppings and meat you get.  We chose the carne asada and I wouldn't even bother ever getting anything else.  The only reason we didn't order another bowl is because I was so intrigued with other menu items.  Next came the fried mushrooms...they come with  garlic aioli slathered on the plate and a chili sauce sprinkled over top.  Just outstanding....nothing frozen...fresh mushrooms, awesome batter....perfection.  Jesus...I'm running out of words for the skirt steak.  It's so simple, but so delicious.  I have no idea what it's marinated in but I'm pretty sure a shot of whatever the hell it is would instantly make any meal better.  The steak was melt in your mouth delicious and cooked perfectly.  We ended with Reuben's...pastrami cured in hose I'm told by our absolutely fantastic server Denise.  It was everything you could ever want from a reuben....just another thing the Sporting Life is good at....making pastrami.  What really got me on the Reuben was the side dish.   They don't stick you with just the option for fries, we were offered the vegetable of the day or a salad and having stuffed our faces with enough fried food already, I went for the veggie.   What came out with my reuben could have been served at any of the finest steakhouses in town.  Today it was this mushroom and garlic medley in some ridiculously awesome brown sauce.  Again, not sure what it was but I wanted to bathe in it....my god....just bring me a whole bowl of that next time so I can dunk my entire face in it and I'll be satisfied.  

Whew.....been a while since I have been so satisfied with an establishment.  I didn't even mention the real dart boards (truly appreciate this being a darter), the 20 some TV's mounted to this awesome steel frame custom fit to the bar, the 15 video poker machines, the skybox room upstairs or the truly fitting Michigan trash can in the mens bathroom.  Really....that was just the icing on an already satisfied cake.  F michigan....hooray for the sporting Life!  Definitely stopping by again when I'm back out getting my gambling fix.  Our server Denise did an outstanding job keeping us lubed up with drinks and explaining the food to us, she possessed a true understanding of the menu and how each dish is prepared.  This, sadly, is such a rarity these days its rather depressing.  

Well done all around!!  The fact that I'm not bitching about anything is a true accomplishment.
Super friendly! TVs from all angles. Good food. Good beer and other alcohol selection. Could be our local sporting venue.

Earlier this evening when sitting at the bar, I told my friend that this was "some of the best bar food I'd ever had in Vegas!"
He replied, "this isn't bar food, this is real food."
That's probably the best, simplest,
& most accurate description of Sporting Life's food!

Tonight was my second time here and all I can say is that it seems to keep getting better every time!
On my first visit to Sporting Life, I ordered the tomato hummus plate and the chicken wings, which were both excellent!
This second time, I showed up during happy hour (double bonus!) I ordered the marinated skirt steak and the bacon wrapped dates to start and they were both absolutely AMAZING! My friend ordered the burger that looked and smelled so good that I had to order one for myself as well! It was undoubtedly the best burger I've had in a LONG time! It came with a side of perfectly seasoned spinach. 

The service at Sporting Life has also been excellent on both of my visits! The bartenders/servers are both friendly and knowledgeable! Looking forward to my next visit and trying out more of their menu items!

This bar has a ton of potential.   The tv's are plenty and large.  The craft beer list is quite impressive as well.  We ordered the Bavarian pretzel and I must say for 9 dollars it was better than the pretzels I had at hofbrahaus.  I also liked that they had wolf run as a slot option on a few of the machines.  The concept is great, I just feel they need a happy hour or lunch specials.  Something to get people to go during the day.  When we went at 1pm there were maybe two other people there.  I hope the bar succeeds because the staff was very friendly.  Wouldn't recommend for a young crowd looking for eye candy but a very nice place to get a good appetizer grab a craft beer and watch any game.

Pleasantly surprised and I will definitely be back. Loved all the screens to watch all the games. Did a short rib dinner with the salad and everything was delicious. Had a great waiter. The place is clean and the lighting is perfect.

Came here to watch march madness. Place is clean and open with plenty of TV's. The reason for the 2 stars was the service and food. The servers themselves were friendly but we ordered 3 plates of fish and chips. It took 45 minutes to get our food. When we asked the server what was up she said they only had one cook. Even after we got our food they didn't have any tartar sauce. We had to wait another 20 min for the sauce. By that time the food was cold. Didn't matter anyways because the food was bland and over breaded. Had the fried pickles and the same. Way over breaded. Would not recommend and will not return.

Local friends brought my wife and me here for dinner tonight, and we enjoyed ourselves very much. I felt moved to write a review, but first I was curious to see what other people had written. 

I think it's hysterical that a few days ago, some guy who has absolutely no identifying information on his profile besides a generic first name posted a two-star review that says nothing about whether he's ever eaten the food at Sporting Life, only that he believes all recent good reviews must be coming from the owner's friends. The funniest part (to me, anyway)? It's the only two-star review he's ever given. All five others are one star. Apparently he likes Sporting Life twice as much as anywhere else he's ever been. :-)

Anyway, to my review (and I assure you, "Brian," I'd never heard of the place OR the owner before tonight):

It was nice to see a pretty good variety on the beer list, and I had a couple of pints of Czechvar. 

The duck confit pizza really is more of a flatbread, but semantics aside, it was outstanding. Generous helping of savory duck, sweet dates, and goat cheese to balance the extremes. Before that, we enjoyed some great deviled eggs - not your grandmother's mayo and pickle juice deviled eggs, but a step beyond and worth taking the leap (and absurdly inexpensive).

Fried pickle chips were in a crisp batter, not greasy, and surprisingly not too salty. We also got to try a pork belly over polenta that the chef was trying out, and it was outrageously good; I hope he adds it to the permanent menu. I also got to try someone's tomato bread - not quite bruschetta, but something very close, and deliciously subtle with an ideal amount of garlic.

We wrapped things up with bread pudding, easily one of the best I've had (though it was a little odd to see it arrive shaped like a brick), and accompanied by salt caramel ice cream.

Listen, I appreciate that people have a pretty fixed idea in their heads what a sports bar ought to look like and serve, but there are burgers, wings, steak sandwiches, and plenty of middle-of-the-road beers on the menu for people who aren't terribly adventurous. If that's what you want to eat, eat it - why should you care what else they serve, or be threatened by what their other customers are eating? If you want a place that ONLY offers The Six Foods Every Sports Bar Serves¬ô, I'm pretty sure there's a Hooters not far away. In the meantime, they've got a good array of TVs and a wide variety of sports on the screens in addition to good food and drink, so it works for me. 

In addition to one or two poker trips every year with my wife, my new job will be bringing me back to Vegas once or twice a year as well. Whether I'm/we're staying on the Strip or not, Sporting Life is going to be a standard stop for us as long as they continue to serve creative, quality food. And for gosh sakes, I might even have "just" a burger one of those times. I'll bet they're pretty good.

I really like this bar! Neal, our server was terrific and very attentive! Especially when playing darts or playing pool you want a server crushing by every 5 or 7 minutes as you drink and develop an appetite.

Normally we don't give huge tips but the server Neal was amazing, we gave him 20 bucks on a 56 dollar tab.

I'm so glad I got to go out to the bar and play darts with my girl. What a good time =)

First off, this is a step up from your neighborhood dive bar. The atmosphere and staff bring a sort of fun feeling to the room. It's bright, clean, and there's no cloud of smoke lingering in the air. 
The reason for the 4 stars was the food. While the deviled egg was one of the best I've had, the fish and chips were overcooked. Correction: I substituted spinach for the chips, which was slightly greasy but edible. The fried pickles were under fried, and had a freezer burn taste to them. 
Great bar, but I'd hesitate before ordering food again.

Sporting life is the perfect local bar! 

Maybe I'm biased as I live close by but it has everything you could ever want. 

Karl the chef is a hidden gem in this city everything you order off the menu comes out and tastes like you are in a 5* restaurant on the strip. 

Levi the server is second to none. Cool as hell and an absolute gentleman. 

The sheer amount of perfectly placed TV's means it's practically impossible to have a bad view of the big game. 

You have to visit here!!

I had an outstanding Buckeyes experience at the Sporting Life Bar on New Year's Eve 2016! 

First, the bar is outstanding. On my first visit I had the skirt steak, beer mac 'n cheese, and a deviled egg, all of which were outstanding. On gameday I had the Ohio State special skyline chili with a hamburger patty. 

Service from the staff is exemplary. They anticipate your needs and are always friendly and attentive. The food is 5 star quality, it is made with care and attention to detail you don't find in other sports bars.

Chris, the Ohio State organizer, was outstanding. As a first time he made me feel like a welcome part of the family! He ran several events throughout the game and kept peoples' spirits up, despite the depressing score.

This is the best place in Vegas for sports in general and Ohio State sports specifically! Come get your buckeyes during gametime!

Absolutely horrible! I was mortified after inviting friends for a nosh after reading a stellar, mouth-watering review of Sporting Life in Desert Companion. What an awful tasting we had. I kept ordering hoping something would redeem the previous gastronomical atrocities. I believe the writer to blame is Jim Begley for misleading, wholly off-base review. Never ever ever will I go back to this establishment. The food was inedible. The steamed clams reeked to the point we had to put them at the far edge of the booth until our server could take them away. The Skin and balls were starchy chokes. The tuna poke was meh, probably the only thing digestible other than the drinks. Thankfully they had czechvar on draft to make our trek across town not totally pointless.  The deviled eggs had no taste, so ok, those could go down. But by god! Why?? What in the name possessed the reviewer in Desert Companion to give this awful assault on palates such a high recommendation? Perhaps the owner or chef is great friends with the critic. That seems to be the only logical explanation in my mind other than a hefty bribe. Don't waste your time unless you're just going to get a drink!! I never write yelp reviews but felt I needed to help offset the well publicized misinformation. Perhaps Saturday afternoon/evening is not the time to go. Perhaps they have some severe deviation in quality at that time. But by god, how does anyone screw up bar food?? Somehow the Sporting Life could screw it up. Don't be fooled. Don't go. Practically everywhere else in Las Vegas tastes better.

Not really sure why this place has so many good reviews.  We started by waiting over 10 minutes for a server to come over.  The drinks and food all took a very very long time so the trend continued.  

Skins and balls- 1 out of 5.
The croquettes were not hot at all and the skins were missing their sour cream that was in the description.  I'm pretty sure they were short staffed because one of the people serving us did not know any of the beers or the menu.

Pickle chips- 1.5 out of 5.  They were very crunchy but didn't have much flavor.

Beer mac and cheese- 2 out of  5.  Served room temp and in desperate need of salt

Skirt steak- actually incredible, a definite 5 out of 5.

Overall experience was pretty disappointing but man... that skirt steal may bring me back

My weekly NFL grounds - what am I doing disclosing my trade secrets?!

This is a great neighborhood Sports Bar but they put out some pretty damm good food.  This isn't your typical joint.  They have Braised Pork Belly, Pan Roasted Trout, Crab Cakes (freshly made), and I can't get enough of their $5 PIzza made on their house made ciabatta.  They make all their beds fresh and everything here is elevated over and above your regular PT's or Dotty's spots.

For game day special, they have several selections of apps for $5 or less and they have $1.50 PBR.   The TV setup is all in one spot so you don't have to turn your head and get neck pains.   And the service is phenomenal.   We always have Denise, a GIants G-Men fan.....poor Denise.....but no, she is awesome.   She'll take care of u - tell her Dave and Chee sent u.

P.S. - It is pretty smokey in here for those sensitive but otherwise, everything else here is the sh1t.

I have a few local bars near me, but this one is the best. 

First the food here is top notch. Not your typical bar food, some standards but with some style. I've tried a lot on the menu, close to everything, I've yet to find something I don't like, even the deviled eggs (I've never like deviled eggs) were delicious. 

Second the staff, from Doogie all the way down are awesome. They all are attentive, pleasant and just there to serve. 

If you pass on going to this bar, you're missing out on a Las Vegas gem.

The last time I ate here was a year and a half ago and my experiences progressively got worse. But I gave it time to grow and decided to try it again. Tried the Mac and cheese, which when they first opened was $7 and I ate in 3 bites. It's now the same price but this may have been the heartiest Mac and cheese I've ever eaten for the price and tastes exponentially better. Good job sporting life for improving your food quality and portions, I look forward to trying more.

TV EVERYWHERE YOU LOOK!

You can't miss a game at this joint for sure! There is literally so many different TVs that for football season or any sport season this place is the place to be! 

MIA & MOUY (hopefully I spelt that right) were our bar tending girls... it was my first time but the hubby & his boss supposedly come here every Sunday for football. These girls are so full of energy & just so ATTENTIVE on making sure nobody's glasses are empty! 

This place also has a box room upstairs that you could reserve for a game that includes TVs all around that room as well! Plus they have a betting score board up to see all the scores.

Definitely a look new place! & it's not so dark like most gaming bars are!

Ive only been to this bar one other time and the service wasn't great but I understood; it was kind of busy BUT THEN I go in last night to give it another shot; this time around 3am expecting it to be somewhat quiet, in hopes of better service and right when I sit down a girl throws her water at the bartender and was yelling about how she caught her sleeping with her friends baby daddy or something? I think I heard the bartender say something like,  "why are you here?" so it was obvious they've met before. I didnt know WTF was going on and if it was going to escalate so I just bounced out and enjoyed a beer at The Lodge instead. People just want to get off work and away from the stresses of their day only to walk into stuff like this? Not a good look Sporting Life.

Food is so good you forget you're at a bar! Not only is Denise one of the friendliness servers but her recommendations are dead on.  We come here alot for the bacon wrapped dates and deviled eggs while we throw back some beers...but tonight we "dined in" and she was so amazing i had to write a review about her! Nachos are a must have also! We'll be coming back as long as she's here

Went to try out a new bar and it was a great decision. The  bar felt welcoming when I came in and they made sure to greet me which is a plus nowadays. In the same minute I sat at the bar I was helped by the bartender Stephanie who checked on me enough that I never needed to ask for something. I ordered their wings expecting them to be  the ordinary "bar wings", but no, I was pleasantly surprised to eat wings that were fully crisp with a gorgeous array of sauces to choose from. Bars with good food are far and few in between so that's definitely another plus! Both Niel and Jan were great when I had questions about the drinks/food too this train of good things about this place never seemed to stop. Will definitely return and also highly recommend this bar!

Place is your typical sports dive bar. Gaming at the bar. Fast service food. Limited drinks on bar. 

Our server maybe Denise was older than most servers yet faster and way more personable. Appreciate her service. Only thing is she forgot my coke and said "I don't remember you ordering one", that isn't the right response.

Fun vibes on football days. They do raffle tickets with prizes, I happen to win one :)

Don't go here expecting over the top. Simple bar food and simple drinks. Nice ONCE and a while.

Me and my boyfriend came in on graveyard and gambled over 500$. And still got a 80$ bar tab. My boyfriend didn't gamble so I understand to pay for his food and drinks. But to get charged for my drinks I was insulted. The bartender said I needed to gamble 1000$ to get all my drinks comped. I will never go back in there and it's sad because it's in walking distance from the house. Not the way you should treat customers.

This review is for 3.5 stars.

I think this is a quality bar to give you your local bar fix.  They have tons of TVs so you'll find any game you want.  They have an ok beer list (nothing rare) but many options that are quality for under $5 which is rare in Vegas.  The food looked typical but the portion sizes were okay for the price.  And they have darts and trivia each week.  I wouldn't say I'd necessarily go out of my way to come back to Sporting Life, but I wouldn't mind grabbing a beer and watching a few innings if I was over on that part of town.
Great place to watch a game - love their TVs and the setup - or - play a game or two. Good food and good fun !

Nice atmosphere, friendly staff, great background music however, I was extremely disappointed that despite my boyfriend and I feeding $80 into the machines playing max bet on 4 card keno(in less than an hour) , we still had a $30 tab. We each had 1 beer and 2 shots only and the only thing that was comped was 1 beer. We were told by Mia that she comped 1 shot.... nope. She comped 1 Heineken and we paid for the rest. We paid the tab and still tipped $10 bucks because we aren't assholes but, we will not be back.

This little gem was a pleasant surprise after the new owners completely revamped it (used to be the outside inn).

This is not your typical bar...it is super clean, open, and a fabulous menu.  

The staff is courteous and food is curiously different. I've tried almost everything on the menu and never been disappointed. They offer unique pizzas, seafood etc. I was shocked how good their skirt steak and clams were. The chef, yes, a real chef, really sets this bar apart.

They have darts, pool tables, gaming...the only reason I'm giving it 4 stars is their gaming/ rewards program is very lacking. No incentive for me to play.

Please give this place a try... I think you will be surprised too!!!

If we could give it more stars we would!!! First the service was amazing!!! Friendly and fast! Secondly the chicken wings blew us away! You don't need a dip for these, great by themselves! The pork belly....to die for!!! Yummy! Our new spot for wings for sure.
Just an update.  We went back...wings, still amazing!!! Mini corn dogs while your watching the games on their many screens are amazing as well. We love the place!

Disclaimer- I do not drink.

I was here to attend a Walking Dead viewing party and the bartender was very accommodating! I had a virgin Bloody Mary and Margarita. Fabulous! I also really liked the setup and how big the bar was. Would attend more viewing parties at this location!

Pretty cool bar in the SW. Drinks were real good, the food was pretty damn good too. Dart boards, jukebox....very cool place.
Oh, and the .50 cent deviled eggs that were delicious too!
Been here a couple of times and always have fun. It's a very laid back place to have some drinks, play some games and chill.
Highly recommend!

I typically don't like gaming bars that much because they're dark and smokey. However sporting life is the opposite of that. Cold beer, awesome bartenders, and and an even more awesome draft beer selection! You can't ask for much more than that. Plus with the amount of tvs in this place it's impossible to miss a game! I haven't tried the food yet so that's on my list.

I have had a fantastic meal here plenty of times.  I just met the chef dan tonight and he definitely knows his food.  My favorite meal is the braised short rib but all of their food is excellent.  They have deviled egg as drizzled with olive oil and topped with fried capers which are worth a try.  They also have a flatbread here topped with braised short rib, blue cheese and Caramelized onions which is good.

The environment here is a step above those of say a PT's or similar bar, which is one of the main draws of hanging out here. I've probably stopped in here a good 10 times or so now because it's so close to my house, but more often for trivia and food than drinking. 

The food here is a bit of a hit or miss. At one end is the special menu short ribs with kimchee and rice which is absolutely delicious and a full meal. At the other end is an average at best chicken sandwich. Again on the plus side, they have some good fries and a large variety of appetizers, some of which are better than others. Skins and balls, despite the somewhat crude name, is a must-try. The pork belly can vary in quality, while the steak is a salty but tasty treat.

My main wish here is that they'd have some more extensive happy hours. They have a late night midnight-2am happy hour on a random selection on food, such as the skirt steak appetizer which is 5 instead of the normal 10 dollars.

As for the drinks, they have an excellent selection of draft beers, though we have on multiple occasions been informed that they had run out of this or that. Prices are reasonable, but not as cheap as a lot of dive bars. My friends have unfortunately not really enjoyed their mixed drinks as much.

Another plus is they have a nice dart board area which is far nicer than most establishments. They even have some real weighted darts to throw, though they're worn and the flights are often iffy at best. Still, if you have your own darts, it's a nice place to play.

Last but not least, the trivia night here is not as strong as other locations, but is a nice little fun activity anyways. Some of the questions are a little too out there, and it'd be better to have a handful more easy ones to go along with the difficult ones. So I'd rather have like 25 questions than 15 with a better pacing and more difficulty variance.

Anyway, this is going to be one of my main go-to bars for both sports (they have a ton of well positioned big screens) as well as just to hang out.

Nice place,  good service,  they have this awesome frequent dining app that gives you rewards after a few visits,  good menu that departs from the usual tired bar menu of wings burgers and chips.  One major flaw for me is their ventilation system,  there is so much cigarette smoke in there it feels like its the 80's. If you are a smoker then you're in heaven but if you're not a smoker then be prepared to come out smelling like an ashtray. There are levels of cigarette smoke in different bars but this one takes 1st prize.  

The  chances of coming back or recommending this place are very slim just because of the smoke.

I went here once before but this is the first time since I moved to Vegas. I haven't eaten here yet so I can't give it 5 Stars but if the food is as good as the atmosphere and the staff then I'll upgrade the review. My server Cassandra was awesome. Friendly, professional and attentive.

Came here for the first time the other day . Did not do much eating but what we did have was good . Deviled eggs ... Yep good . Big pretzel yes good . Bartender was attentive and explained future dishes we might like . The bar itself for being a video poker bar is quite spacious and nice . Darts were a hit amongst our friend in between feeding 20.00s into the machines. Jukebox was also very popular with current modern songs deck . I'll definitely be back ASAP to try the Chicago dogs and pastrami Reuben and the wings !

Updating to add that I still love Sporting Life and am so happy that they are officially the home of the Ohio State Alumni Association's game day parties.  They've really gone all out with a special Buckeye-centric menu and beer specials until Carmen Ohio is played. Fantastic deals with items that cover about anything you'd want from breakfast food on through.  Other game day specials continue after the Ohio State games. The atmosphere is exceptional, and Scooter, Doogie, and the staff are awesome at keeping the party going. I've always had great service and the food has been consistent. 

I'm super happy that on game day they added Cincinnati style chili to the Buckeye game day specials. They serve it as 3-way, 4-way, 5-way, and chili dogs.  It's the closest taste to Skyline I've had since moving away from home.  I've been craving it since I tried it and can't wait for Saturday to roll around again.  Other places in the valley have tried to imitate it and don't come close.  Sporting Life's version is an absolute winner.

It's absolutely THE place in Las Vegas (and maybe anywhere outside of The Great State of Ohio) to watch the Buckeyes.   

It's the Best Damn Bar in the Land.
Great food and great service. Fun and friendly environment. Tons of flat screens with all the games. Sporting life bar is the breath of fresh air that the local bar scene is missing!

This place should actually get less than one star. The bartenders are very inattentive and rude. I sat down for over ten minutes with no service and was not approached one time after my beer was finally served. I wanted my check and had to walk over to the four bartenders sitting at the kitchen window who were eating and chatting for a decent amount of time. I asked for my check and not one of them moved. Don't bother drive the extra two minutes and go to Lucky's!!

For a bar, I am going to give them 4 stars overall. 

The food is good for a bar, I like the Pork Belly. 

They are an Ohio state bar other wise I would have given them 6 stars LOL. 

I have always had good service and good food here, even though I have only been here four or five times over the course of a year.

This place was recommend to us by a friend and we stopped by on our last day of vacation. The food is amazing. Not your typical bar food at all. We had a few of the 50cent deviled eggs, short rib flatbread, and a portobello mushroom burger. All excellent. We talked to the chef who said they make everything from scratch.

My favorite local bar on the southwest side hands down!!!! Don't know if living just 2 minutes away from here is a good thing or a bad thing! Food here is amazing. Not just your normal nachos, wings, and pizza. There menu goes beyond that. Coming here the devils eggs are a must for me...Haa yes devil eggs its simple but it goes best for me when I'm playing KENO. My favorite is the chicken sandwich with egg and extra onions! Best place to watch any sports games!!! GO TAMPA BAY BUCS!!! Don't forget the upstairs private room for any parties or gatherings! More of a PLUS THE Bartenders and waitstaff give great customer service! Big ups to the bartenders Troy, Levi, Steph, and Moy. When you don't have to ask for a refill and your new drink is there before you look up, that is expecting your customers needs ahead of time! Bottom line, if you are looking for great service and for a great time with a great friendly atmosphere LOOK NO MORE here is the local spot to be!

I went there because it was do close to my house. I will never go there again. this was some time ago but sat near a woman and I use that term loosely and she met a guy there obvious she knew him well. there conversation was loud and filthy. when I complained to management they did nothing. as I left they were still at it. will never go there again!!

Been here twice now.  Still not a fan of the deviled eggs (lets chalk it up to personal prefrence) but I must say that the chicken wings (whole wings) are some of the best wings I've ever had! I love wings. After I enjoyed them I was informed they are salt brined and then confied in duck fat before they're fried.  Let's just put it this way, I had to stop myself from eating the bones.  They where amazingly juicy and literally would pull right apart from the bone like it was cotton candy. The ranch which I used for the celery and carrots was delicious, you could tell that it was made in house and not store bought. I still haven't had the steamers, I'm dying to try them but I think I might have ruined that chance by trying the wings first. Not sure I'll ever order anything else.  They also had an oxtail poutine as a special tonight that I really wanted to try.  

I can tell you this, I'll be back again and any place serving wings as good as theirs is 5 stars in my book!

I love this bar! I have been going here for a few years after work mostly but always a good go to spot for any event.  Levi and Troy are my bartenders they are the BEST and work graveyard so I always get one of them! They food is really good here as well.  It is not your typical bar food. I always eat the skirt steak and beer mac and cheese but recently tried the chicken fingers and they are so fresh and delicious! I highly reccomend this place if you are looking to have good food and drinks. Oh and they have darts.
Good food, Shitty service.
Had their apricot pyramid ale.  It was delicious.  They have a board games section...I'm sold.  Auto 5 star bar.
Great bar, friendly folks. I liked the Tuesday night trivia. Try the mushrooms, fantastic!!!

Really nice neighborhood bar with a community family feel. Has dart tournaments on Wednesday. 

Food: Good food for a bar. HUGE portions. They play around with traditional bar favorites, but make them a nice cut above what you would find elsewhere. They're very decently priced and you'll more than likely leave feeling pretty satisfied.

Game 4 of the Golden Knights. The bar is packed. Two of the televisions are off by our table ("they're broken," we're told) and someone is standing in front of the one television at eye level. The volume is non-existent and the clarification of trivia questions during play is distracting. The wait staff (all one of them?) is so overwhelmed that I feel bad for her. No one (in charge) is stepping up to assist. Food is horrendously backed up in the kitchen and, honestly, it's not the same quality as during the Ohio State games. I'll be back for college football season because this is a great bar and the alumni association puts on a great show. However, with the abundance of sports bars in Las Vegas for events like the Golden Knights and (soon) Raiders, I'll find somewhere else to watch sports and grab some food with friends.
Delicious deviled eggs... beer battered mushroom is surprisingly delicious.. love thus place.

Tried a few different menu items. First thing I tried was the fried pickles. Did not like the batter that was used and the sauce was lacking flavor. Second thing was the beer Mac n cheese. I like Tenaya Creek beer, so it has to be good! The cheese sauce was loaded with salt and very watery. The noodles were thick like fettuccini noodles and long like egg noodles. Bacon fat pasta is what the noodles are called. The third thing I tried was the short rib flat bread. The bread itself was over cooked and was as thin as a cracker. Red wine mushroom duxelle spread was also loaded with salt. Did not taste red wine at all. The picked braised short ribs lacked flavor. Caramelized onions was blobbed on two of the eight pieces. Ate about three bites and couldn't do anymore. Still think the burger, fries, and fried Oreos are good.

I moved to the southwest area some months ago,  so naturally I had to find my neighborhood bar. My fiance and I stumbled into Sporting Life one random night and met Troy. 
Troy works graveyard Sunday through Wednesday. He's not only an attentive bartender but a good friend now. This is my bar! 
Several dart boards, 
Pinball, 
Excellent food,
A ton of T.V.s,
And a ticker during game day!
Thanks to Troy's suggestion the chicken sandwich I tried is amazing. 
The Ruben is great only I do no sauerkraut (personal preference) and sub coleslaw on the sandwich.
Fish and chips are ridiculously good and a large portion at that. 
They have a $5 dollar wing special on Saturday nights and their wings are no joke.
Four fully intact wings with drum, flat, and the tiny little extra wing tip that just adds to the fact their a real full wing. Beware their mild is a medium,  anything above in their house made sauce has serious kick. 
And holy cow for dessert get the fried Oreos. They are AMAZING! Once my fiancee and I ordered two orders...
For local neighbourhood bar it doesn't get better.
The blackened chicken Caesar salad is to die for!! I legit crawl here exhausted after work just to inhale it ! The bartender is so nice and I am in love with the deviled eggs! Just sayin

It's a OHIO STATE BUCKEYE BAR!   Amber was friendly and cool!   Their lunch special is cool too.  $7.99 u get deviled eggs 1/2 a sandwich and a hot cookie!   It's cool cause I can walk from my place if I'm drunkie.  I'll check it out for a game but I hate to cheat on my other BUCKEYE bar.... Did I mention it's a BUCKEYE BAR!   :)

For anyone who has wished for great quality at local pricing this place has struck nirvana. When you have the head chef and sous chef of arguably the best French restaurant in Las Vegas "bouchon"  taking  over the daily kitchen operations at this great sports bar, in my opinion we have now finally hit the first great gastropub of Las Vegas. If there is any downfall which I am really picking right now, is the amount of time it took staff to see me at the table but in their defense I was by myself and I do not drink. Chef Dan is truly doing magical food at this establishment and for anyone not to go in is just doing a disservice to themselves for this remarkable gastropub on South Jones
Awesome bar! Food is great. Love the staff great group of folks. The tv's are fantastic. My favorite bar in the neighborhood. Very welcoming.

Atmosphere is nice and bartender was pretty nice. Food was alright, nothing special in my opinion. The main reason for the low rating is because they ran out of captain at about 7:00pm. To me, that's a no no, especially for a bar. I haven't been back since and don't really plan on it.

I must say this bar is my absolute favorite place to go!!! I work in the service industry and have become very picky about the service I receive, that being said I have had some of the best times and greatest service from the staff at Sporting Life!! Levi is one of the newest additions to the sporting life family and he has been wonderful!!! His personality is outstanding, he is able to connect with so many people from all different aspects of life. I first met Levi when he was working down the street at another bar (I only visited once) when he saw me for the first time he recognized me and made mention of it, I was extremely impressed! He served me one drink months before and he remembered who I was, to some that may sound creepy but to those of us who do this for a living that is being great at your job!! He does a great job accommodating everyone in his bar and he does it with a smile on his face and a jump (literally) in his step. I make it a point to come visit Levi and Troy at night, and Mouy, Jenny and Denise during Sundays for the game.
Great food, great service and a super fun night of trivia.  We will definitely be back!

Great Bar for Sports.. I would make sure you visit them.. They have great Set Up fpr TV's very rare for Gaming Bars. But this is a MUST place to watch sports off the strip... I would not suggest the food except for the Appetizers.. But overall great service!!!

This place is the SHIZZNIT!! I wish I remembered my bartenders name, working the Sunday afternoon shift, she was a cutie for sure! Had a little loud mouth on her, but very entertaining! She recommended the pork belly dish, which was AMAZING! 

Great bar concept. I've put together a few bars myself doing Audiovisual and surveillance, but whoever did this, I like it! I wish I live on this side of town cause I would visit more often. Keep it up Sporting Life Bar!

Went here with a few friends because it's right down the street from our house, we frequented The Lodge before it was this place.


We got a table next to the bar and waited patently for our server, about 15 minutes later a waitress  slowly came over and handed us menu's. She was very nice and polite and pointed out their draft beers which we ordered 2 pitchers. We had one friend that wasn't drinking and he was promptly brought water. The beers on the other hand, took about 8-10 minutes. When we got the pitcher it was half foam, we were pretty disappointed. So we poured our drinks and waited for our server to come back. We asked about the foam and she said we were going to get (1) free beer.. Which was brought also extremely foamy. 

We ordered, and everything was extremely over priced. (In my opinion) and they weren't serving desert at 10. I enjoyed my steak sandwich, but my buddies didn't enjoy what they ordered. They only offer wings in increments of 4. The wings were pretty good.

The atmosphere was nice. Great music and all the local sports on the TV. After we ate; we played darts, which was fun.

Overall this is a fun place to go and have a beer. I wouldn't recommend the food due to the price.

Only giving two stars instead of one due to our waitress being extremely polite and helpful. (The beer foam was not her fault)

We ordered:
