POM Margarita, Grand Slam, Fried Pickles, Bacon Mac & Cheese, Burger, And Steak Sandwich 

Drinks: Hello, alcohol? I thought I ordered you? Where have you gone? I just drove for four hours and haven't eaten anything since 10AM. After half my drink I should have been a little tipsy. And a margarita without salt on the rim? Huh. 

Fried Pickles: Good batter, but lacking in seasoning. Pickles were stuck together. 

Beer Mac & Cheese: The worst. First of all, that's not macaroni, it's pappardelle. Horrible sauce and what is all this bread crumb business? It's not helping the dish, it's making it much worse. 

Burger: Its a burger. I'm surprised that they didn't screw it up due to screwing up Mac & cheese. It was fine. 

Steak Sandwich: Good. Cooked perfectly. Could have been warmer. 

Overall, everything could have been seasoned better. It was all missing that kapow! 

Service was fine. They were short a server and weren't afraid to say it. Our server was very apologetic about the wait. Hopefully it's not always like this, otherwise it would be a problem. 

Can't wait to come back when this place picks up its game. They've got some good things going - advance that and we're on to something.

troy, you the man
this spot replaced PT's and Sierra Gold for me

*clean bar setup 
*no cigarette smell
*attentive bartenders
*they have Hennessy, plenty of IPA's on draft 
*great food (my girl loves the chicken tenders with mild and ranch sauce)
*they got a jukebox with an app you download so you can play music from your phone
*all kinds of TV's playing a bunch of different channels
*dart section, booth seating with separate slot area and dinner section too

This place has a nice set-up with the darts. I saw some people (aka people I went to meet) showing up with their own dart kits. Talk about hardcore. Well, after all, it's called SPORTING LIFE bar, right? You better bring that pep and sport in you. Go big or go hooooome. 

Nice open space, and for a bar, this place has LEGIT food. A friend of mine was eating the gnocchi, and since the chef used to work at Bouchon, it looks EXACTLY like the Bouchon gnocchi's!!!!!!!!!!! What a winner, since that's my fave item at Bouchon. The brown butter sauce was a bit lacking, so more was ordered on the side. 

Nachos were decent. Not my absolute all time favorite, but I shall return to try more items in the future. 

I gotta be honest though, I kept calling this place, "Life Sporting Goods." The bar name just sorta confuses me. I thought it was a sister company of Sports Chalet. 

Service- 5 stars. 
Ambiance- 5 stars.
Food- 4 stars. 
Bar name-  ........ no comment.
This place is going to be awesome. Love the food, people and the ambience. What a neighbourhood bar should be. :)

Went there for the first time last night & will never go back. The service was terrible!!!  2 bartenders & neither one ever came over to check on us or refill our drinks. We gambled a few hundred dollars & it was like we didn't even exist!!  Much different from the awesome staff that was there when it was Outside Inn!
The menu simply does not match the concept of the bar. Not that the food is bad, but when I go to a sports bar I want comfort food, not upscale bistro fare. $11 chicken wings? No thanks.

Saturday night, the new sports bar on the block has great press, and a good pedigree yet is 2/3 empty. A bad sign. Our server, as kind and attentive as can be, informs us that there will be a delay as people didn't show up for work.  Ok. The place is mostly empty, but we'll go along for the ride. 

Drinks come, and they're fine. 

Our first appetizer comes (fried pickles), and I'm a little shocked by the meager portion.  They taste alright, but the pickles are all stuck together and under seasoned. Not a great beginning.  

The second appetizer comes out, beer Mac and cheese. A disgrace.  First, the chef should read the definition of macaroni.  It doesn't just mean pasta (this Mac and cheese uses a flat noodle). I'd gladly forgive this transgression, but the flavor was just awful.  Pointless, overpriced, and not fit for human consumption.  

Ok, so we're very concerned at this point and have lowered our expectations greatly. The entrees arrive (after a while, but we were primed for this) and the burger was actually good. In spite of my burned bun. The steak  sandwich we ordered tasted alright, but was cold, and chewy.  

A total disappointment.  With Las Vegas being a culinary heavyweight these days, there's no point in returning. I'm sorry I came to begin with. I have the Weekly to blame. #trustbutverify

Talk about a hidden gem! When my husband suggested this place for lunch, my first thought was - eh, bar food, but I was pleasantly surprised! Definitely not just bar food! I had the warm spinach salad-delicious! Service was fast and friendly and prices were reasonable. We will be back!

Been here few times now....sorry, still haven't made it to ordering any food yet....

nice spacious local bar, plenty of TV's to watch sports and plenty of machines to sink your moolah into....love triple double video poker!

great service too, Muoy is a great bartender, always keeps a cold beer in front of me....hey, maybe that's not a good thing? haha, it is, keeps the brain wet

place is nice and clean, pretty high ceilings, although it does get smoky in here sometimes

promise to try food here soon and update my review!

Great sports bar, local hangout for Mizzou Alumni. They have poker machines at the bar, and a players club where you earn 100 points and get $20 in free play. Theres a private party room upstairs. Great service, but the food is just so-so. The pretzel bites tasted like a boxed frozen product and the cheese dip was curdled and runny, not good and would not recommend. The chicken tenders are tiny,  or a little, little! A bit overpriced for what you get. The dipping sauce was excellent though. PBR pints are 1.75 during college and NFL games. Overall, a cool place to watch a game.

I understand that you're Sporting Life "Bar" but if you're going to advertise "Five star Food at One Star Prices," give me somewhere to eat said food without having to sit in a cloud of smoke. Lost my appetite. Will not be returning.

This is a pretty cool place to watch sports. Tons of tvs and a very spacious bar. They carry a large selection of draft beers. They have a lot of food options and they have a spin to it. We ordered the chicken wings, but I really did not enjoy the whole wing. The wings were also overcooked so I was not a fan. The fried mushrooms were also different, but again I was not a fan. The batter was plain and it needed more flavor. The fried pickles had a white batter. They were a bit better, but overall I was not impressed with the food.

During football games they offer $3 Coronas and $5 bloody Mary's! Not a bad deal after all!  If you only care about a bar where you can watch the game, this place offers a good environment for it!

I like this place.  My second trip here to watch football.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  The service was kind of slow but it was the first Sunday of football and the place was packed.  We had to wait for the 10am games to finnish before we got a seat at the bar.  I had the short rib sandwhich, it was ok but the fries were good.  I like the selection of beers on tap, the only place I know of that has Hop Box on tap.  There are plenty of tvs and a scoreboard with betting lines.  I really like the set up of this place....it was a good time....even got to see a guy throw up on the floor.  I will be back!

One of my favorite local spots in the area.  One the surface it's a typical local gaming sports bar, but it's actually an unassuming culinary wonder.  Ok, well culinary wonder is a bit much, but it sure sounds better than awesome place to eat; which it is. 

You wouldn't think a bar like this would have such a unique menu, but you're in for a surprise.  The trend in local Las Vegas seems to be more gourmet/gastro-pubish food in gaming bars, and they certainly are setting a standard.  

My favorite items:
-Pork Belly and Polenta
-Deviled Eggs
-Chicago Style Hot Dogs
-Beer Mac'n'cheese
-Tacos; they are awesome!
-Killer Beer list

Plus it's a nice place with a good darts area.  With a grouping of cozy booths, it's actually a decent place to bring your significant other.

Most sports bars offer chicken wings and sliders, bar top gaming, and the ubiquitous Golden Tee machine.  But how many of them offer braised pork belly served on top of house made polenta, or a braised beef short rib Philly sandwich?  Sporting Life Bar has taken a sort of casual gastropub approach, where both the food and beer selection is of much higher quality than your typical neighborhood bar, but the pricing sits far below your typical menu at self proclaimed gastropubs.

I was admittedly hesitant to eat here based on some previous reviews, but either I have wildly different taste in food, or maybe the kitchen has gone through some recent changes for the better.  Deviled Eggs were basic, but at only $0.50 per egg, it makes for a cheap snack that comes out fast.  The Braised Pork Belly with Polenta was a winner, nice and tender with a sweet glaze that had me wondering if I should get another order.  I also tried a daily special, Korean style short ribs served with house made kimchi.  The ribs had a good kalbi flavor, and they were quite tender.  Trying to take one bite meant having all of the meat fall of the bone effortlessly.

Beer selection here is good, with Brooklyn Lager, Ballast Point, Ommegang and Green flash being offered on draft.  Drafts I've had ranged from $4-$6; not too bad.  Bottle selection is decent too, including Deschutes, Kona, Dogfish Head, Duvel and Stone.  You can also get a flight of three beers for $10.  How many sports bars do that?

Outside of food and drink, they also have a Tuesday night pub quiz that starts at 7:00pm.  On Wednesday nights they have two rounds of darts tournaments, at 7:30pm and 12:30am.  I haven't been to either event, but the main reason I first came here was to play darts, and they are serious about it.  An entire wall lined with cork holds four steel tip dart boards, and the throwing line is built into the floor; it's not just a strip of tape on the ground.  House darts are of better quality than at other bars, but it seems that most people who come here to play bring their own dart sets; again, people are serious about it here, and it's a cool spot that caters to it.

While not located in my neighborhood, the combination of good food, good beer, and good darts has easily made this a locals bar that is worth driving to.  Not only is this a sports bar that the southwest deserves, it's one that it needs.  Proof that a bar does not need to be a generic, cookie cutter chain that starts with a P and end with a T.

An experience so terrible that it sparked me into writing my first ever Yelp review. I recently met up with a few friends at this bar to watch some basketball. I cringed when they told me this was the place we were meeting. My first visit to this bar a few months back was beyond dismal. My buddy wanted to give it a second chance because the concept behind the bar sounds like a great place to kick it and watch sports. I was hangry and recalled them having some pretty decent food, so I decided to give it a second chance as well. Little did I know of the ridiculousness that would ensue... I almost reached my breaking point sitting in a booth for close to 10 minutes, waiting on a server to order myself a drink. She came along just as I was getting up to go to the bar to order. After finally receiving my drink, I took a sip and a deep breath. Ahhhhh, I finally had a drink, I'm chillin', things are good. Then, out of nowhere, i see a couple dogs in the bar. I look closer to see if they were assistance dogs because I have no problem with a professionally trained dog being in an establishment. But nope, just you average, rowdy dogs; one being held back because it was trying to jump up on people and the other small enough for the owner to allow it to walk on one of the back tables for people to walk up and pet the pup. Were we in Sporting Life Kennel?? I was confused. Still, I was fine with the dogs because it wasn't affecting us...that is until we decided to order food. The waitress finally made her way back around to us and asked us if we would like to order food. Looking at me first, I started telling her my order. I was looking down at the menu while ordering so I didn't realize that, mid order, she bent over and started playing with one of the dogs. MID ORDER. We all look at each other like is this really happening?! Finally she stands back up and asks for my order again. No apology or anything. I politely told her I didn't want to order food anymore and to move on to the rest of the group. Her response killed me. "What? Don't worry, I'm gonna wash my hands." Really, woman? That's what you think I'm upset about? Rude. Finally, the game we went there for was about to start only to look up and see 3 black screens and Fox News on another. No game. We tried to tell them what channel it was on but they did not listen. Or maybe they couldn't hear us over the extremely loud trivia game being played throughout the bar. At that point we all had had enough of Kennel Trivia Life Bar and decided to all head home to watch the rest of the game. The game they claimed was not on TV. What a disappointment this place is.

5 stars is the combination of chicken wings, skirt steak, cheese balls, service, friendliness, cleanliness and price taken into consideration. There is trivia, hosted by the owner which is fun. I love playing darts, keno, poker, pinball and i can do all that in piece here. Quality crowd and staff.

So, they just opened, we went to try it out. We sat in the bar area at this table with a long wooden bench that was not very comfortable. They had four really nice looking booths, but they were already occupied, the rest of the tables were in the bar and were mismatched and didn't look very comfortable. We sat and waited and waited and waited. We saw two servers talk and discuss who was going to take our table and yet no one came over or even acknowledged us with a smile or anything. Another couple came in and sat down and they got menus at least from a less than friendly server. After waiting almost 8 minutes w/no acknowledgement, we got up and left. With this kind of service, I don't know why they even bothered opening. There are too many good restaurants in Las Vegas to waste our time and money to be ignored. This was a disappointment since we have been looking forward to this place re-opening since we live just up the road and we used to go there a lot when it was the Outside Inn :(

I had read some solid reviews for Sporting Life and decided to check it out. This place is a sports bar, 100% geared toward adults who are looking for a place to drink, smoke, maybe play some video poker and watch the game, so leave the kids at home! I liked the dart boards along the wall, and there is a loft upstairs, which I assume is for private parties, since I didn't venture up there. I had a few draft beers and a Cuban sandwich, which was a non-menu special; here is the rundown...

PROS: For a Vegas sports bar, this place has an incredible menu! I have read great things about the food, and from looking around, the menu items I observed others eating looked great. As I mentioned I had a Cuban sandwich, which was tasty and filling. The fries were piping hot, and the appetizer deviled eggs I had easily could rival my Grand Ma's! They were simply excellent.

The service was spot on. The guy behind the bar gave me a sample of a beer, and was cool when I ordered something different. Very friendly and attentive. I liked the layout of the bar, and there was plenty of room without the place feeling big with wasted space.

The beer (Tenaya Creek Brown Ale) was ice cold and crisp. I was tempted to order a "Dark & Stormy" (Rum with ginger beer) for only $5! Finally, the price was very reasonable. 2 beers, small appetizer and a sandwich for about $23 minus the tip.

CONS: My main complaint was the wait time. I ordered a few deviled eggs and a sandwich with fries. It took about 15 minutes for the appetizer and another 15 minutes for the sandwich. The sandwich was good, but wasn't as hot as I'd of liked it to be. It seemed they grilled the bread to fast, so that the outside was was a little over cooked, but the inside was lukewarm. Still, the sandwich tasted great, with thick slices of ham, cheese, pickles and mustard. And the skinny fries were very hot. The bar wasn't super packed and the wait time was a little unreasonable. I usually don't mind waiting for great food, but sandwich should of been a little hotter. 

For the price, and being a locals bar, I really like the food. Next time I'm going for some of the other menu items I've read about, as it looked great from what I saw. Definitely going back to Sporting Life... You should check them out!

Sporting Life is our "home bar" since it's right across from our house. It is spacious, has a large party room, slot tournaments, trivia nights, and darts!

The staff makes the place. Scooter (owner) and Dougie  (manager) make sure everyone is having a good time. They're very personable and fun to talk with. Troy and Stefany are our favorite bartenders. Always fun conversations and great service!

The food is great too! You HAVE to try the Pork Belly as an app. My favorite entree is actually the spinach salad with added chicken. The chef makes a bacon vinaigrette is to die for! Love the chicken sandwich too.

Great bar to spend your free time at with friends or significant others!

This place is fun! They have darts and picnic tables to give it more of a baseball sporty ambiance.There are also booths and a bar as well if you opt to not sit at a picnic table.

The drinks were good as was the food, not nothing to rave about. What you would expect for a bar.

I would come back here mostly because it's close to my house and they have darts!
Too much fun. Such a great time. Thanks for everything. Hope to see you all soon. Especially Cassandra. Too Cool!!!

I work in the area and love this place  They are amazing. I can call in food orders to pick up on my lunch which is only 30 mins and never have to wait more then a couple mins when I arrive before I get it. We sometimes hang after work and always seem to have a good time. Thanks Sporting Life!

Well, this place has only been open 6 days. It is nice and clean, very open so no real option for a non-smoking section. The bartenders were cool. I tried the portobello sandwich which was awesome. I like the menu and yes it is different from a normal bar menu, which I found refreshing. My husband wasn't a fan on some of the beer prices but that is something that hopefully will be adjusted. 4 out of 5 stars!

Where do I begin?  I really, really want to love this place but it's hard to!  The food is ok, I had the chicken wings but they were a bit overcooked not juicy and the sauce needs a bit of work. 

 I think the biggest complaint I have here is probably the service.  It takes a long time to get a drink and even longer to get a refill, plus the staff behind the bar needs help!!  Let me be clear, this is Vegas and never do I ever, EVER want to have a pregnant woman serving me drinks.  They've put a lot of work into this business, if they put as much effort into properly staffing this place it might work.
Get mikes pastrami or mikes ruben ! Its not on the menu you have to ask for it to be made. Its great you wont regret it.

I moved here a few months ago looking for a good bar that I felt comfortable. I went to Sporting life and have never stopped coming. Between the amazing Bartenders, the great food, and the fantastic managers, I wouldn't want to go anywhere else. I am so glad I found this place! They always have every game on... Football, basketball, hockey, etc... And that's hard to find as a Chicago fan!  You will find your favorite bartenders on every shift. Try the pulled pork sandwich, it's fantastic! 5 stars all the way! This is by far, my new favorite hang out!

Came here to check out renovation, and was a bit surprised with the huge change. Everything is much more modern and colorful than it was before. The d√©cor was nice and a little bit on the trendy side even. We were very impressed with the bountiful amount of flat screen TVs everywhere and the huge one on the side wall. Which is great for watching the games. 

Aside from the bar, they had booths, dart boards and what appears to be a 2nd floor, maybe PDR? I'm not sure if there were pool tables; I overheard someone else wondering about that too. As far as service, the bartenders were cool. As far as prices, their drinks are reasonable. $4.50 for my vodka-pineapple & $4.75 for Miller Lite. We didn't try their food as we came from dinner. The only thing that we noticed that it was pretty bright inside despite it was around midnight. A little unusual. I would say the ambiance would be better if they can dim the lights a bit. Also the manager asked us to move as a patron wanted to play the machine. We looked around for a spot as the bar was pretty full and he finally pointed some spots across the bar by the draft taps. When we moved there, we noticed that it took a while to get our drinks re-ordered. Maybe because we were behind the taps, so no big deal.

Overall experience was good. Drink prices are reasonable, bar was nice, & service from bartenders was pretty good. We will come back. We also think this place would be great for the games.

Delicious food! Friendly service! Not your average bar food. Been here for lunch numerous times and finally taking the time to review. The green chile pork nachos are amazing! Portions are huge so sharing is caring. 

Lunch service is quick and their specials are perfect! This is definitely a weekly spot for me. I would love to check it during a football game because the atmosphere is great for games. 

Must try!

It's been a gathering place for my friends and each time they're around here, I tend to miss it or bow out. I almost did again because I had friends in town, but we also had a birthday going on.

It's a neighborhood bar in location and feel, but it's the little details that make it. 

It's one of the few places with multiple dart boards. I also don't like those plastic divet kinds with the safety tips and prefer cork board and metal tips. Theres also a pinball machine and golden tee if darts aint your thing. 

The food is more comfort food, with a twist. More gastropub style than average bar with offerings like duck confit on the menu...it was not what I expected to see. I only took bites of friends orders, but the food seemed decent. There were some hits and some misses discussed among the group, but I didn't follow as I was swimming in food from having dinner prior to coming.

There seems to be sweet specials. At this time there were drink and $5 meal specials for football. There is also a happy hour 4-6 Mon- Fri and lunch specials before 2pm. It seems you can come out of here well fed and libationed up and entertained with darts for pretty cheap. The fiance got a Ballast Point off tap and one of the football meal specials, brat with fries for under $10. 

I think that I would come back. Its quiet enough if you want to be left alone yet spacious enough that if we were being a bit chatty, we're not bothering anyone at the darts area.

My husband and I sat in a booth in front of the bar for literally 12 minutes and not a single person helped us. We weren't even acknowledged when we walked in the door nor when we walked out. We were never offered drinks, or asked to wait while a server was free. They weren't even that busy for a football Sunday, so there was no reason to blatantly ignore us. That was the first time and the last time we will ever visit this bar.

This is a cool place to hang.  Came here on a Tuesday night with some friends to watch the MLB all star game and play trivia.  We won the trivia and the prize was to have our bar tab paid for which was very cool.  We had a lot of drinks and the food was great.  We will definitely be back to try more food here and dominate the trivia games.  We had good completion but our crew dominates in sports, geography and unnecessary useless knowledge.

Sat down at the bar, waited for bartender which seemed too busy talking to notice me. When she finally got to me I asked for a shot of patron, I got ended up With a really watered down shot that tasted like more like water than anything.

Sunday October 16th, for the owner's reference.

One star for atmosphere, one star for friendly server... when we saw her anyways...

What a mess...
I really wanted to love this place. The exterior is adorbs and the interior is cool... that's where it's appeal ends. When we entered at 1:30pm on football Sunday we took a moment to find a table facing our game. Easy enough considering most tables were occupied. And then we waited... and waited... and waited...
10 minutes later I approached the bar. "Do we order here or are there waitresses?" I was informed there were waitresses and that one should be over soon to take orders for drinks. I ordered our beers and a soda anyways. Ten minutes later our beers arrived... no soda. Another ten minutes... soda arrived. I was starting to sense a trend. Twenty minutes later we ordered. The server (possibly a manager?) apologized and made excuses for the wait. The food was abysmal. I mean, really. The best thing we had was the deviled eggs which came on a bed of oil. Interesting... The mac & cheese bites were bland, the hot dog bun was soggy, the queso dip was SOUP (I sent it back) the pretzel bites weren't horrible, the hummus was so thick and CHUNKY that it resembled pulled pork... gross! 
The empty plates sat on the table for over an hour even though the server came over to check on us three times.  Shameful.

In conclusion: I don't know what is going on in the kitchen, but it ain't good  I'm guessing that the service issues are due to under-staffing. This place could be GREAT... but it's just plain sad. The only thing that saved us was the bucket "0" beer. 
We will not be coming back... ever.
Had a great time watching sports and having some cold beers. Michael was very friendly and respectful! Happy camper beer and fresh lemons with a bit of salt "what more can you ask for?

This bar is the most chill and friendly local bar that I've had the pleasure to visit in town. All the patrons I've met are all personable and friendly. This is also one of the only bars in town where you can request your own speaker to tune into the sound of each individual TV for any event. The Grammys? Listen live with your favorite cocktail, and much more.

The staff are some of the best in town, from the wait staff all the way up to the owner. Wednesday's at 7 is the weekly slot tournament, thanks for teaching me Scooter! Now to the bartenders, Mia is the only person where I can walk away down a $1,000 and still have a smile on my face. Shout out to the rest of the staff though, you guys rock! 

Just get yourself down here and have a great time!

Awesome kitchen, very seldom disappointed on anything and if so in the least we stay with what we have tried and like the most.  They have an actual chef here ....I believe and he has obviously trained his cooks well.  Bartenders, wait staff and bar backs are top notch also.  Our favorite pub and there are lots around that we tried before picking this one as  our regular hang out.   Also excellent for a small (20 or less) dinner party for whatever the occasion located upstairs.  Nice to be able to move around before and after the actual meal is served.  Fun place, great food, give it a try if you are anywhere close.

Items Selected:
Warm Pretzel Bites - Beer Cheese Dip
Cracklin Jacks - Pork Rinds, Chipotle-Honey Roasted Peanuts
Duck Confit Flatbread - Medjool Dates, Goat Cheese, Sweet and Savory Moustarda
Bourbon Bread Pudding - Salted Caramel Ice Cream

Located on South Jones and long on my radar as a place to watch The Buckeyes it was finally for Saturday NFL action that I stopped in to The Sporting Life, and setting aside an early service gaff that left me entirely ignored for nearly ten minutes the subsequent hundred minutes and four plates passed during the course of a Panthers victory over Atlanta was a mix of the expected, impressive, and truly surprising.

Open 24/7 with packages for all the major sports allowing them to cater to all varieties of interests, it was just after 3pm that I entered the windowless tavern and with Christmas decorations still lit juxtaposing a central bar plus a few rounded booths and several tables it was suggested I seat myself - a hightop in the back with views of NBA, NHL, and playoff football action in full display as servers dressed in Scarlet and Grey and Cleveland Browns polos made me feel right at home - the lack of an annoying bar-tunes soundtrack an added bonus, though I'm told it plays on other nights when trivia or darts crowds fill the room.

Treated to complimentary WiFi while sticking to water as my drink of choice it was to a wide ranging menu of bar-food staples and intriguing upscale options that I focused my attention and opting to sample a little of each a four part order was crafted, the kitchen expedient while service improved dramatically after bonding over Ohio State's New Years Day win.

Starting with competent $5 Happy Hour Pretzel bites paired with hoppy melted cheese served alongside a Cracker Jack-riffing composition of pork-rinds and peanuts that tasted every bit as ludicrous and decadent as it sounds it was at a deliberately slow pace that savored each bite and eventually finding the tilted bowl empty the second part of the order was sent out, a crisp flatbread somewhat uninspired in its lightly charred crust but exponentially upgraded by toppings that walked a fine line between sweet and savory, the confit surprisingly moist while well-chopped dates and poignant goat cheese each found a willing dance partner in acid forward moustarda far more nuanced than one would ever expect in a 'bar.'

Admittedly biased in my love of desserts it was still to the server that I deferred when asking which sweet ending he thought was best and although it would have been ordered anyway his strong support of the bread pudding should not go without notice, the half-melted-on-arrival ice cream a bit of a turn off, but the texture and flavor of the amalgam of butter, caramel, and flan-soft brioche truly transcendent and on par with that at Truffles n' Bacon for the best of this style served in the valley.

With 24/7 bars featuring video poker, cheap drinks, smoking, and weekday party games as much a staple of Las Vegas culture as the 24/7 diner is to that of The Big Apple it is more than a little impressive to see a place like Sporting Life willing to take chances with the menu and although not everything here is perfect, particularly the smell of smoke in the air, one would be hard pressed to name another place turning out a duck confit pizza at 6am - no less a top notch bread pudding available at all hours of the day.
Excellent food!!!!!  Clean and great sports TV's.  Had 5 different menu items and every one of them was FANTASTIC!

My favorite place for NFL Sundays!  Good food, a must try for dessert is the fried oreos made to order 
Denise is my favorite waitress! Wonderful personality and quick.

Delicious food especially the wings. Not your typical bar food. Better than the average. I was told that they have an actual chef that makes the menu. Troy, our server/bartender, was very informative and knowledgable about the menu and all that goes on at the bar. He was also well mannered, funny and on top of things.

Thank you Troy and Sporting Life. Will definitely be back again.

Atmosphere was good, food/drinks options good, but service was blah. I understand if our server was overwhelmed, but multiple times order mistakes were made and the Cap n Crunch chicken tenders were chicken fries that took close to an hour to receive which only takes 5 minutes at home. The chips were stale (and I'm 8 beers in, so my quality bar is pretty low) which took too long to get as well.

Came here for some drinks & to watch college football one Saturday evening. Our bartender (he also looked like he could be a manager) was very nice & even let me try a few different beers because I couldn't figure out what I wanted! We didn't get any food because we had already ate, but I saw someone eating pretzel bites & I definitely made a mental note to come back and try them!

The initial visit: A friend had listed off establishments that had steel tipped dart boards. We came and had a few beers and played darts for hours.

The return visit: A  Generated a love for $14-$20 pitchers of beers, a menu that draws from French to Asian cuisines, and a friendly staff. Yes, they still have the classic bar items, yet some have a new face. The grilled portobello mushroom burger is my go to meal. The large and tender cap is big enough for the perfect bite each time. With a generous amount of their pesto spread and the substitution of avocado instead of mozzarella makes for my perfect sandwich. Especially since they make their own breads and buns. This one comes on a soft pretzel bun. The pig ears and pork rinds are my guilty pleasure. I can pretend to eat healthy. I'll grab the flowering kale salad or my preferred burger, but somehow my drunk self always goes back to this crispy, salty snack. 

The downside: I am not the biggest fan of their liquor selections and I want a shuffleboard table.

The continuing draw: Tuesday night pub quizzes and what got me to return.

Worse burger I've ever had. I was better off going to mcdonalds. Didn't have any flavor what so ever and the fries were under cooked and also needed flavor. I had the fried Oreos as a dessert and those were yummy. Drinks were a reasonable price and the environment and settings were nice. I really liked the way the bathroom looked, weird I know but as a girl, that matters.

Excellent appetizers!! There is a huge selection of draught beers and its always cold. I tried the nachos and fried mushrooms. They were delicious and I highly recommend them. There is an area off to the side for darts, and a pinball machine. I didn't play but I'll check it out next time for sure. Huge TVs everywhere with sports on. The booths on the side are very comfortable and perfect for watching Sunday football! Will certainly return to watch some games and hang out.

I've driven past this place a billion times and just thought it was another generic neighborhood bar, until i decided to stop in a couple of weeks ago! let me just say.. this place is awesome! awesome service to say #1.. every single bartender and barback that i've come to contact with has been so friendly and hospitable! jason is great!! i even stopped in by myself to watch the panthers game last sunday. although i was the only panthers fan in the building, i felt at home :) there are tons of TVs to watch all games. the food is pretty awesome! deviled eggs are a definite must get! they also have darts and a private room upstairs for special events and games. this is my new spot in town! glad i finally discovered it :)

It's rare for me to be given out all 5.  Let just say I am very happy to have found this place.  It's one of my fav bar in town.  

I love how clean this place is. Example, the runner who took away my food was wearing gloves; he asked our server to bring me a fresh cup as I requested a refill due to sanitary concern.  The runner courteously explained that their policy say the runner who takes food away don't serve food to customers to avoid cross contamination. 

The wings and nacho is awesome. My favorite dishes at this place so far.  

I love the Tuesday night 7pm trivia night. The music is awesome.  The staff are trained properly.

I was excited when the place opened.   If you love all that is sport you will love the place.  Not a bad seat in the house.  They have a ton of really nice flat screen tvs.  The decor is clean and inviting.  Yes - A bit bright.  I'm sure that can be fixed.  I thought having a live betting odds board was a cool touch.  I enjoy sports gambling and knowing the latest information while I watch the games is cool...especially for not being in a casino.   I love football and can't wait to see what the place does for the games.

Personally I think the food is a breath of fresh air!  I think the menu has classic "bar" food everyone knows and loves.  Create your own burger, nachos, potato skins, wings, french fries, (which you can get loaded) and two types of steak sandwiches.  They offer things you don't see on traditional bar food menus as well.  Hello Pork Belly? .50 cent deviled eggs?  Personally I like duck and glad to see you can get 2 duck tacos for $4

The wings are super delicious.  You get 4 WHOLE wings.  Which for those that may not understand 1 "Wing" includes a wing, drum, and flapper.  I was told the wings are confit in duck fat then fried crispy.  The meat literally falls off the bone and the skin was crisp!  

I used to live on the east coast (Jersey) and I saw they are making Scrapple.  That is something I've not seen in years.  I can't wait to try the Scrapple when I go for breakfast.  

I guess if you want the boring everyday pub food you eat at PTs there is one on every corner right?   I'm giving the place 4 our of 5 stars. Mostly because yes, it was a bit bright for a video poker bar. The AC was blasting and it was a bit cold and the men's room smelled "perfumy" which I guess is better than the alternative.  

The bar service was outstanding.  There was a bald guy behind the bar who was attentive and had a sense of humor.   The other bartender was super nice and had a great smile.  They both seemed down to earth and friendly.  We didn't sit at a table or interact with the other servers.  I for sure will go back again.

Stopped in for breakfast and was told the cook had yet to arrive. I said I'd wait and after 5 minutes, Cindy, the bartender graciously offered to do breakfast and afterwards said the meal was free as a thank you for my patience. Even without the freebie, I have to commend Cindy for her warm and caring hospitality which, in turn, reflects on management.

I visited the life last night and had a couple magic hats, and a little keno/poker in a seemingly friendly and casual environment. I am not sure why they are an Ohio State bar but I was told they have too many tvs to sponsor only one NFL team? I may return at some point to try the food.
Waited an hour for food and it was dead and the cooks Burnt the app and then took longer to just put our food in for Togo... won't be coming back.

We have been several times and enjoyed the great food and reasonable priced drinks.  Lots of TVs if you want and dart boards too.  A little smokey but not too bad.  
Our server Marie provided excellent service, recommendations and some humor so we felt welcome.
If you are a wing fan GET THEM!  We love them as well as warm spinach salad.
Looking forward to our next visit

Huge bar with good beer selection. 24 hour food available. TVs everywhere so you always have a good view. Got to try the deviled eggs! I think they are 50 cents and they are bomb! Always open and always serving good drinks and food. What more can you ask of a sports bar?!
I had to ask for the Wi-Fi password and the cell phone service is real bad! Clean bathrooms! Great Service! Manager was professional! Bartenders were great ! And sexy !! I will be back !

Rude and absolutely terrible service. Came here to watch the NBA game. Sat for over an hour at a table and got absolutely no service.  The server kept helping the table next to us and we kept trying to wave her over while she just ignored us. The manager/supervisor even came over and asked us to borrow a chair for another table TWICE.   Both times we sat there with no menus,  no drinks and no food.

OK I'm updating this review because we recently did a fantasy football draft here in the upstairs room (didn't know it existed...great for large groups) and everything was excellent. 

The service was great, they had about 4 pitchers of ice cold water and glasses set up, and drink orders were taken quickly and returned quickly. Drinks were nice and strong too! Food was delicious, everyone enjoyed their meal. I had a pulled pork sandwich and a green side salad. Really good! Lots of positives from our group on their meals.

Downstairs the bartenders were very welcoming and always asked how you were doing. This is a great sports bar with lots of tv's for viewing. You could even watch a few tv's from upstairs. Wifi was fast and free. Not much else to say other than its clean, its comfortable, and service and food were outstanding. I just wish it wasn't so far from my house.

Thanks everyone...will be back as often as I can!

I had so hoped this bar would be awesome because it's less than a mile from my house, and I've been looking forward to making it my go to neighborhood bar. After months and months of waiting for them to finally finish renovating, both the food and service were a disappointment - and I didn't even walk in expecting much. 

There was no online menu, but since all the other reviews commented on how the food really didn't match a sports bar, I thought it could be really good.  An overly ambitious sous chef who came from Bouchon sounded promising as hell.  I was impressed when we walked in and saw that the daily taco was duck confit with chorizo, and only $4 for 2!  Unfortunately, execution on everything we ordered was kind of a fail. 

Duck confit is almost always good, but I wouldn't have known that was chorizo if it hadn't said so on the board - assuming it's house made, and the spices weren't there at all. There was also so much creme fraiche that it overwhelmed everything else. I would maybe order it again, but more because it's so cheap than for flavor.

Potato skins are pretty standard bar food, but they tried to fancy it up with fried croquettes, that I assumed would be potato, but ended up containing liquid cheese with fatty bits of bacon in it. The potato skins were burnt and the portion was ridiculous - it really was 1 potato skin (1/2 a potato) cut into 3 strips. It was a typical potato skin, nothing special and for $7 I wouldn't suggest ordering it. I also have no idea why it's called potato "skins" on the menu - because it's actually a singular skin, not plural? 

Duck confit pizza (which actually should be "pizza") was in reality a flat bread - they could argue that it was an extremely thin crust pizza, but that would be a bs. There's a fair amount of duck, lots of goat cheese, chopped dates, a really sweet mostardo (like fruit chutney) and a couple things that weren't mentioned - huge dried apricots and dried whole chilis. This was an ok dish. The chilis and savory balanced out the sweetness somewhat, but not enough. I like heat, but it really also needs to be mentioned in the description that the whole chilis are on there. We were told that "everybody loves" this dish, but I wouldn't order it again. 

Deviled eggs were good, but can you even screw that up? Maybe with too much salt. But that was very good and only 50cents each. 

Service was friendly from 1 girl, but I think the pregnant bartender just looked like she wanted to go home, which she did later as she just left without closing out our bill, or bothering to say anything. We were at the bar but ignored the majority of the time. After trying to flag down someone to pay the bill for 10 minutes, we had to get up and give it to them at the other end of the bar. 

They refilled my friend's water constantly, and my drink was cheap only $6 and pretty strong. Those were probably the only positives of the night. And they have lots of big TV's, so this bar will be good for games. But since I don't watch sports I likely won't be coming back.

Nice place. Good food. Location is pretty good too. It's in a nice spot right on Jones Blvd. 

My second time here since watching some football last season. It's got a real good vibe with a nice selection of beers as well. Bartenders are quick with the drink as well. 

Had the chicken nachos and a frosty beverage whole enjoying some sports on the tube. It's really a place to enjoy football if you're from out of town as they have all the games on the TVs that surround the whole place. Not too rowdy on game day re is a lot of passion in the room. 

All in all if you're looking for a spot that has its own flavor and isn't one of the regular "chain" local spots than check out the Sporting Life. It's good stuff,

We had put a huge amount of effort into ensuring our trip to vegas was a memorable one. We were 6 Irish guys who wanted to do the full vegas experience but top of our list was somewhere to hold our dart tournament. Now we didn't just want somewhere with dart boards we wanted somewhere to spend the day, eat great food and drink good beer. We were looking for a gastro dart pub. Impossible we thought until we found this gem
We had looked on yelp and found sporting life. I contacted the bar and scooter emailed me back to say they would be delighted to have us. He gave us directions and we hopped in a cab from the luxor. It was about 25 bucks so happy days. When we got there and walked through the door there was an audible gasp from the guys, it was like they had built this bar just for us. 4 brand new dart boards all together.  This however would have been for nought if the food and beer weren't up to scratch. We were delicate from the night before but our waitress helped us through their menu. I had the most delicious Reuben sandwich. Bread was crispy , pastrami plentiful and full of flavour. Scooter himself was there and he helped us pick the best beers to try. We're a diverse lot and we he helped pick a perfect one for each of us. The czechvar was particularly good. He even joined us in a few games of darts . To have a bar owner give you this level of attention was great to see. 
We played darts for the day and never had to once look for service. Our waitress was polite attentive and funny , what more could you ask for. Having enjoyed our first meal so much we decided to go again which we would never normally do. This time we went with a range of food for us all to share, the nachos nearly caused a riot between us they were so good. 
We can not heap enough praise on scooter and his staff. When shifts changed the new waiter that came on was to the same high level and organised taxis back to our hotel. We spent 8 hours there and loved every minute. Every Irish person we know going to vegas will be sent to this great bar

I'm rating this in terms of a sports bar.  

Food was good.  Not the normal fare of a typical sports bar.  I had the pork belly, wings, potato skins, and the cheese filled potato balls.

Pork belly was good, the sauce will stick to your teeth sometimes and you may hit a salty spot here and there.  But over all nice flavor and tender.

The Wings were fall apart tender.  Good flavor, but again hit some salty spots.  I wish I try some of the other sauces.

The potato skins were a bit under cooked for my taste.  Call me old fashion but some sour cream would have gone well with them.

Cheese filled balls.  I wish the cheese used in the balls was more chewy and less watery.  If it was not a liquid when you ate them it would have been about 100 times better.

Inside of this place was very roomy, but we ended up right next to some smokers.  It is strange to be eating food that's pretty good, and yet have people smoking around you.  I guess I'm just not used to that any more.  That's what Vegas was like when I first moved here years ago.

I've never heard of this place, but am always on the look out for hidden gems in town. Unfortunately, although this place may be hidden, it is not a gem.

My friend and I decided to order and share a few items from the menu. We got the duck confit tacos, which were a daily special, deviled eggs, duck confit pizza and potato skins with croquettes.

None of the food we ordered was amazing but I did enjoy aspects of each dish. The duck in the pizza and tacos was really good, but the other items in each dish left a lot to be desired. The tacos needed a little more flavor. The tortillas were a little dry and the tomato and creme fraiche were bland. The pizza, which was more of a flatbread, was good but overly sweet. My dining companion came across lots of chiles on her slices but none of mine had any of that. The goat cheese added a nice savory flavor, but the fruit definitely overpowered this dish.  The deviled eggs were good, but very basic. I would recommend these at 50 cents each. The potato skins, which was basically half a potato cut into there measly slices served with three sad little cheese croquettes. These were the least appetizing of everything we ordered. Drippy and watery cheese inside a fried ball. I would not recommend this dish in the least. 

Service was ok at first but once it was time to settle our bill, it took forever for someone to pay any attention to us at all. It was even more annoying given the fact that we were sitting at the bar. 

The menu is ambitious, but lacks in execution. This would be a great bar to enjoy watching a game or fight, but I don't think I would have much reason to return.
